text: This place is most authentic Italian restaurant you will find in Arizona!  The food is excellent and the service is great too!  Living in New York for a few years I grew to appreciate good Italian food, which is hard to find in Arizona....I found the place, this is it!
Used to love breakfast here. Today great service but worst food I've ever had. I think I was served yesterday's bacon, sausage patty raw in the center, potatoes burnt, and toast cold. Won't be back

We wanted pasta for dinner, so we went here because it was close to home. Large portions and good food.   I still have some left overs that I will be eating for lunch today.  Yum.  Will be coming back again.

Run away while you still can! or Order the pizza....I was dumb I should have gotten the pizza! Do not I repeat do not come here for pasta! It is a pizza place which I figured out after we already ordered which sucked especially after eating the gross pasta which came to our table and saw the delicious pizza which went to others' tables. We got here and for a busy place they score for having a place for us within a few moments. The server was super helpful and we did not have a need of anything besides better food :/ We normally go to La Piazza Al Forno but my husband raved about this place and why not? Well next time nope unless it is pizza. The bread was the best part of the meal! I mean its bread you can not ruin that right?   But I will have to give them credit it was the best bread I have ever ate. But here comes the bad part the meal ugh~! The sauce was super water down it felt like we were at a place which needed to save money it was that water down. The chicken which should have been able to basically cute with my fork I had to saw at with a knife it was that hard. I felt cheated.   And then comes the worst part did not finish meal heck barely ate or poked at my hard chicken so I figure order dessert and maybe that will be a winner nope nope and nope! I ordered the Tiramisu it was just as horrible as the chicken the best thing I could think of when eating it was it tasted sorta old like a old gym sock never had one to eat but it just did not sit right. I should have sent everything back but I also did not want to create a fuss rather I guess write a review. So remember people buy pizza from a pizza place and not an Italian dessert they do not know how to cook and or pasta they do not know how to cook. I think a little caesar's pizza was better than this meal which cost us 40 something dollars. Also soooo loud I could hardly hear my hubby let alone the waiter here.
Hands down..best west of the mississippi. Cannot wait to go back. You won't be disappointed.

This place is my favorite place for breakfast! I haven't tried them for dinner too often but I know their pizza is very good. The service is always consistent when I come here! I definitely recommend people to check out this place, not many people that I know are familiar with this place but it's a good one to try!
Yum. Great lunch beal for slices. Great flavor. And a really tall hot bartender. Win win!

After following reviews from fellow yelpers, the wife and I finally tried this Restraunt.  Due to the fact that my wife makes outstanding Italian food, I rarely find a good enough Restraunt to come close to her cooking. Until now!. This place has all the makings of a GREAT Italian Restraunt! I tried the chicken Marsala, and it was good! The wife had the eggplant, which she said was cooked perfectly. Both of our portions could have fed us twice! We both tried a slice of pizza, and agreed that it too is better than most out there! Only reason there is four stars is the service was a little slow, but in the servers defense, she was serving the bar as well as waiting 5 or 6 tables! Lots of people in the Restraunt means good food, and I don't mind waiting a bit for good food!   Overall a great experience!

This is one of my absolute favorite places!  What a hidden gem!  My husband and I used to visit frequently when we lived nearby and need to go back soon.  The food is perfect every single time!  The pizza is phenomenal and all of the pasta dishes are authentic, flavorful, and delicious!  I recommend Times Square to everyone I know!  Glad we found it!

My husband and I use to love this place but it's not the same anymore.  We stopped for a late night dinner and I ordered  arabiata penne NO MEAT...I'm a vegetarian but I was served sausage in my penne.  I took the first bite and was disgusted by the taste! It's difficult to get that taste out of your mouth. To make matters worse,  my husband was almost through with his dinner when I got reserved. Then, we weren't  served the bread until after my husband was done with his dinner. The bread was uncooked and had to be sent back.  The manager brought another bread but this time the top was cooked and the bottom wasn't.  Not once did we get an apology.  We were both fed up, so I complained to the manager about the  sausage in my penne he said "mistakes happen, we fixed it, right? "  Hardly the way to treat customers.

We have been eating at this restaurant for 20 years and have very seldom been disappointed. The food is always great and has never been a problem. The service on the other hand is hit or miss. After a significant service issue yesterday and today we will never go back. We made a last minute decision to call in an order for pickup on our way home for the evening. Upon arriving within about 2 minutes of calling in our order we were surprised to find the parking lot half empty so we thought what the heck we'll just dine in. Upon walking in the bus-boy seated my son and I and my wife went up to the counter to let them know we had changed our mind and would like to stay and eat. Upon her return to the booth where we were seated she commented that something was up as she could tell the staff was frustrated with our changing our mind. Upon the arrival of our waitress we were informed in no uncertain terms that this was a violation of their policy and they should not be letting us eat the food we had ordered in the building (which was half empty by the way). It was so uncomfortable even our 16 year old son suggested we just leave because we obviously were not welcome to be there. My son and I retreated to our vehicle and my wife stayed behind to wait for the food. Even though we should have just left it behind we didn't want to walk out on the $72 of food we had ordered and leave them hanging like that. While she waited for the food the same rude waitress made it a point to contact the manager on the phone in a purposefully outspoken voice to ensure everyone within earshot would know she was right and reaffirmed aloud the policy of not flipping a take out order into a dine in order. The situation was confrontational and even a departing customer felt the need to tell my wife that this is the policy everywhere. Since this was the first time we had ever changed our mind about a take out order we had never run into this policy before, especially in a half empty restaurant, maybe it's some sort of weird health code thing? Regardless, the policy really wasn't the issue and they were willing to make an exception anyway, it was the way we were treated and the behavior of the waitress that was clearly inappropriate. To be fair, the staff member behind the counter (Brandy) seemed embarrassed by the situation and did repeatedly apologize to my wife as she assisted my wife with the order. So today we call and ask to speak to the owner (Paulette) as of course she would want to know what happened in her restaurant to customers of 20 years. My wife is told she is at the Scottsdale location so she looks up that number and calls her there. Paulette's first concern with the call was how my wife got the number to her location in Scottsdale. My wife then starts to describe the situation to Paulette and about half way into the story she is cut off by Paulette so she can reinforce just how important this policy is and that her team knows if they don't adhere to the policy they will be terminated. Several attempts were made to inform Paulette that the policy has nothing to do with our problem and it was the way we were treated that we took exception with however Paulette clearly was not interested in hearing this and never offered an apology, not even a fake one. It is easy now to understand why there are service issues at this restaurant, it reflects ownership. We will now make sure our friends, parents, adult children and their families, and EVERYONE who will listen will never step foot in this establishment again.

Delicious. Simple ingredients,great flavor. Fresh and to the point. Priced right can't understand why anyone would ever go to Olive Garden or to Macaroni Grill when this is right down the street. Shrimp were good, jumbo scallops were fresh. Tiramisu and Cannolis were fresh delicious and obviously homemade. Service was good, we had a young male waiter very nice and really knew the menu. We eat out quite a bit, and are extremely picky. We will definitely be back.
Been there for Dinner, been there for Lunch, Been there for Breakfast. Excellent all the time. GREAT food, GREAT service, feels like they really appreciate you.
I was looking for  nice tiramisu and I found this place. It disappointed me, I would probably rate it the lowest among the ones I tried. Bread pudding was ok.

Went in here for lunch today, and it was spectacular.  From the outside, you wouldn't expect it to be a great place to eat, but when inside, it's fantastic.  Had a cheese steak w/ peppers and onions, and it was phenomenal, for a very reasonable price.  Walking out I was looking at other folks plates, and the Italian dishes looked spectacular (as the others in my group claimed from previous experiences).  Can't wait to go back for dinner.

If you want excellent Italian food in Phoenix, look no further than Times Square. I have been going here for years, and I LOVE this place.   Growing up in New Jersey, I've eaten Pizza at many pizzerias, some being better than others. When I moved to Phoenix, I noticed that nobody really makes good pizza out here, until I found Times Square. This is the most authentic New York Style pizza. The fettuccine alfredo is also delicious.  The ambiance to this restaurant is has a casual/classy feel to it. I usually wear jeans and a polo shirt when I dine here. The restaurant is somewhat small and not fancy, but it has a classy/casual feel to it.  The bar is great and has ample seating. I love that this place always has beers other than the normal American lagers. Last time I was there they had Long Hammer IPA, Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, Peroni, and a couple other beers on tap.   Overall, this is an amazing restaurant and there is nothing bad here.

We have eaten here no less than twenty times. The entrees are usually always above average. Why the one star then? The service here has been atrociously horrible lately. Our most recent experience. We arrived to a nearly empty restaurant on a typical Sunday night. It took a long time before Katie, our server came over to greet us. We ordered two waters and a Mai Tai. We also ordered two entrees which were absolutely delicious as usual. We ran out of water twice (once for me. once for my date) during the meal and had to get a different server's attention to get the water. Not once did she ask how our meal was, or if she could get us anything. When our food arrived, I told the new male server to please tell Katie to forget the Mai Tai. When he told her, she explained that she forgot. No big deal, we're all human. In the meantime, she did have several long conversations with the two men in the booth behind us, as well as long conversations with Paulette the owner. After the meal, we ordered the bread pudding. The bread pudding is always served hot from the oven with a warm to hot bourbon sauce. We are not normal bread pudding eaters, but this stuff is sensational, trust me. However this time they placed the Hot bread pudding on top of ice cold bourbon sauce. This error has happened in the past, and usually they fix it. By this time, we've been ignored, had to ask for water refills, never been tended to after the meal was delivered, and we had to leave our seats to get Katie's attention regarding the bread pudding. When she came by to see what we wanted, we told her about the bread pudding, but also told her it was one of the worst service experiences we had ever had there. She asked why, and we explained that we had felt like we were treated like second class citizens. We explained to her all of the flaws in service we had experienced. She offered to fix the bread pudding and warm it up, but we could see that we had perturbed her,  so we asked if she could just get us a side of sauce warmed up. It was quite evident that she took offense to us verbalizing our bad experience. The owner Paulette Cano came over to us and actually confronted us! She thought it was inappropriate for us to tell her that we "felt" like we treated like second class citizens. She berated us as if we had no compassion and told us that we are all human. I took offense and asked Paulette, "are you actually confronting me because I voiced my concerns over bad service?" At the same time the bourbon sauce arrives and it is boiling hot. The butter and lemon has actually separated. I guess they showed us! At this point we asked for the check and never finished the bread pudding. It took at least ten minutes for us to receive our check. It was clear that a line in the sand had been drawn. This is as comparable to Amy's Baking Company  behavior as I've ever seen before. Shame on you Paulette. We won't be back!

1st time there and they couldn't even get a simple sandwich right! Ordered chicken parm sandwich, got there, paid for it, got ALL the way back home to open a Philly che steak......W.T.F.? Will never try the again!!!! The lady actually said to me "well if you come back I'll put your name in my draw for a free sandwich".... Um no, never again, void my payment and refund my money bc now I still have to go back out to get something else to eat. Live to far for this. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE

Times square just opened up another location at the end of the Scottsdale airport. Formally New York bistro. We have been going to the deer Valley location for years, and are very thankful that Paullette and her team have purchased this new location. Went there for dinner the third night they were open, amazing as always. This is a great spot, you must try it.

Delicious!  Went here for dinner about a month ago with my husband and a good friend.  All of us enjoyed our meal immensely!  I had a delicious shrimp pasta with a creamy tomato sauce - loved that they split the shrimp in half - made it very easy to eat and ensured I had shrimp in every bite!  Perfect!  My husband had a chicken and sausage pasta dish - he especially loved the sausage and says he will order the sausage and peppers next time so he can have more sausage!  Our friend had chicken marsala - her go-to dish - and said it was really good.  We will definitely eat here again - can't wait to try more dishes!

Visited here for a late lunch and was pleasantly surprised. This is a "neighborhood" type restaurant so the atmosphere is relaxed and casual. Many families with children in to eat. Not too noisy. There is a bar to sit at if you want to enjoy a cold beer.   My husband had the Bay Scallops with pasta and he said it was excellent. (I can't eat shellfish so I couldn't try any.) Presentation on the plate was very nice. The scallops were arranged carefully for view and the sauce was a light red sauce.   I had the Pollo Marconi and was a little skeptical about tomatoes and eggplant together but it was great! This also came with a side of pasta and it was all very tasty.   Garlic bread came with the meal and we ate very little of that only because the food was so good we didn't need bread to get in the way!  Our waiter was courteous and attentive. When the waiter was busy with other tables the bus boy came by to see if we were good on drink refills.

Went in to the Deer Valley location with a party of six. there were 2 empty tables for eight. The waitress said nothing was reserved, but we would have to wait for a family of 6 at a smaller table to finish their meal before she would seat us. Really? We are fairly new to town and have eaten there several times but we are no longer a fan of this place!
Love Time Square on Deer Valley.  Food is great, especially the Calamari.  Service is great.  Staff is steady!

We always get good service and great food here! They can get very busy on Friday nights, so we might call in a to-go order instead. Breakfasts are large portions and probably the least expensive to be found compared to any of the chain restaurants!

Third visit, first post. Small , crowded, loud, and great. I've had lasagna, antipasto salad, mussels and bay scallops. On my last visit 2 days ago, 6pm on Thursday. Full house again, but 6 of us seated within 5 mins. They were out of large sea scallops so I settled for the bay. They were good, but not great. I enjoyed the mussel and salad dinner more. Generous servings, reasonable price, excellent service. Not a fancy place at all. Just good homemade tasting Italian.

One of my local hangouts! Pollo Piccata is fantastic. It gets pretty packed for dinner most of the time. Want a quick in and out...call a head for a Cheese Steak for lunch and pick it up on your way by. I also adore the Cannoli. The staff is friendly. Hang at the bar and grab a drink while you wait for your table. And if you like Insalata del Mar....it's awesome here.

I came here because of the fairly high Yelp rating and left here disappointed. First of all this place employs a lot of teenage to early twenties kids who seem to have the attitude that they are to good to work for their paycheck (But that's all kids now days so I won't hold that against them)  I ordered the plain cheese pizza because how can you mess that up, right? Wrong. Bland and doughy is the way to describe their pizza. The place was packed so people must like it. Not me. I think you're taking your chances by dining here. Will not be back.
I went to the new Litchfield Park location last night. I had the peppers and sausage over pasta,  it was delicious. The staff was very friendly and they knew a lot about the menu. We will be back.

Best place to eat in phoenix. I went to this place almost every night when I was going to school out there and I miss it soo much. Wasn't a bad place to have a drink either although the bar was small. Try their suicide wings, if you like hot stuff this will melt your freaking face off!!
Food is amazing and staff always helpful. All sauce is made to order. My only complaint is they don't deliver.

This was our go-to neighborhood restaurant! We recently moved 15 mins away and miss this restaurant, we still travel back here though! We have never had a bad meal, their food is amazing!  If you're in the area, you have to go! Breakfast, lunch or dinner - all is great.  From the outside you expect a little diner but its so much more than that.  I love this place!   We bring our 2 young kids and they are super friendly with them.   The place is really busy on Friday and Saturday nights, but the line moves quick and they seat you as soon as possible. The staff is very friendly and hard working.   My favorite meals are the Fettuccine Toscana and the Cioppino.

Unassuming family style pizzeria with great food and service. Chose based on yelp reviews and it did not disappoint. Pizza was delicious. Ingredients were fresh and crust was flavorful. I ordered a mushroom, onions, spinach, and sun dried tomatoes with Alfredo sauce and it came out great. Staff is friendly and attentive.

I found Time Square while on Yelp looking for a new place to eat.  The reviews were very good, so I decided to give it a try.  We went in around lunch time, so they were busy, but we didn't have to wait.   My husband ordered the special, eggs benedict and I a veggie omelet.   They kept the coffee coming which is always nice.  I didn't notice how long it was, but thought we should be getting our breakfast soon, only to have the waitress come back and tell my husband they were out of the benedict sauce.  They should have know this, especially with it being the special, so he ordered the eggs, bacon and french toast.  The food was very much like your typical diner food.  We thought it was good.  The waitress was good and apologized for the long wait.  She gave us our coffee for free.   We will give them another try, probably for dinner.  I will update after we do.

Italian food and pizzas, with everything you'd expect on the menu: seafood, chicken, veal, salads, soups, sandwiches (even cheesesteaks). Also open for breakfast. Reasonably priced. The staff is very attentive and friendly. The food is just not inspiring.
I love this place.  The food is always awesome and the people are always friendly.  Our server tonight was Kristi and she was the bomb.  She makes you feel like family.  We will be sure to come back.
An externally nondescript restaurant that I have driven past numerous times that boasts an excellent atmosphere and some of the best cioppino I have ever had.
We always call in our orders for pick up and they have been great! Orders are always correct, wait is not long, and food tastes great!
We always love coming to this place. They treat you like family and the food is incredible.

I've been going to this place on and off for the past four years for B-fast. Over all solid food, although we asked our server if our home fries could be chopped smaller and crispier and we we told the cook wouldn't do it! That sucked! We got boiled large slices of potatoes that were not cooked??? The prices are high for B-fast and you should have your food the way you want it. I would not judge the place on this one experience, and I have heard the dinner menu and pizza is good. All said and done try this place for dinner and save your money for the Denny's across the street.

My husband and I tried Times Square for the first time. I had the baked ziti which was good but I felt like it was lacking just a tiny bit of flavor. My husband had the Linguini Aglio E Olio and added chicken which he was pleased with. We split a side of 2 meatballs covered in cheese which was good but I feel like they could have done more with seasonings. We got out order for take out. They gave us 2 large pieces of garlic bread that went great with the pasta. I'm looking forward to trying other pastas since baked ziti can be on the boring side. I also ordered the brownie since it was cheap and sounded good but it was pretty dry and flavorless so we did not eat it. I will definitely come back-it was packed for a Thursday night (which must be a good thing) so we may stick with take out orders.

Terribly disappointing. I ordered the lasagna and it was inedible. The pasta was literally too tough to cut with a knife and had obviously been microwaved. I returned that for the spaghetti bolognese which was metiocre at best. They didn't drain the pasta so it was swimming in water. The bathroom was disgusting and not stocked and what I can only presume was the owner or manager sat at the bar and ate during a lunch rush. I've never writted a restaurant review before, but felt compelled to due to this poor experience. Save your money and buy chef boyardee... You'll get better quality.
Ordered lunch from them. Really enjoyed their pizza. My favorite pizza in Phoenix. I wish they delivered to my home.
the Italian food is excellent, the pizza is good.
I have been here several times. Never disappointed.!!!!! I'm from New York, we were raised with excellent Italian restaurants. We know! Lol.

My husband and I just love this place we went there the other night for dinner Shay was our waiter he is fantastic we love when we get him.  The food here is amazing the portions are large you'll go home with a lot.  They must be doing great they opened another location.

In a word, excellent.  We stopped in for lunch on 7/17 based on Yelp reviews, it did not disappoint. Cozy little place that feels warm and friendly.   The service was prompt, attentive, and cheery. The lasagna was fantastic!   My lunch companions were both impressed with the food and service as well.  Will definitely return soon.

Everything I've tried here, I've liked! It gets pretty crowded during the lunch hour but they're always been able to accommodate a larger group it seems! The prices of what I wanted seemed a bit high to me but I always managed to get somtehing in my lunch budget.
Delicious! I've been getting to go dinner from Time Square for the past few months and I feel strongly this is the best Italian restaurant I've been to in Phoenix!

The breakfast is the best. And the linguini and clam sauce is to die for. A friend put me on to this place 2 years ago and I have never been disappointed. The staff is very friendly, however, the building needs some renovation. Despite this short coming I highly recommend Times Square if only for its food. You will not be disappointed.

The Times Square Neighborhood Restaurant is a neighborhood jewel. Breakfast is tasty at a totally reasonable price. Dinner of pizza and wings were some of the best we have ever had. A great local restaurant with excellence service, great beers on tap, and authentic Italian food at such a reasonable price. Don't pass this place....it truly is a must try!

My boyfriend and I went here last night on a recommendation from his mom and we had a good experience except for a couple things that bugged me.  We sat down and had our drink order immediately taken, which is a plus. Then my boyfriend ordered an app, the Steamers(New Zealand, white sauce) and he said they were delightful! For our entree, I ordered the Chef's salad and he ordered lasagna. His looked fabulous and he said it tasted amazing and just like home. I had ordered my salad without onions, tomatoes and peppers and it came out with everything on it and quite frankly, it really bugged me. I had to take everything off so by the time my boyfriend was halfway done I had just started to eat my salad. I work in the industry so I didn't complain but it just would've been nice to know if it came pre made cause then I would've gotten something else. We ordered cheesecake and tiramisu, he got his to go and I wanted to eat mine there, and as I was eating it smelt really heavily of cleaning products. We look over and someone was mopping the floors a few tables away from us. They close at 10 and we looked at the clock and it was 9:40 with 3 tables still sitting including ours and I ended up taking mine Togo cause the smell was horrid and I couldn't enjoy my dessert. Overall this restaurant had very good food and we really enjoyed going there, but I gave it two stars because of my food mishap and the early cleaning while guests were still there.

They also do an amazing job at catering!  We choose  Square to feed over 200 cub scouts and their families last night.  The food was wonderful!  They are so professional and gave us amazing customer service.  The big crowd loved the food.  We will be using them again!  And a big thank you to Ilene!
Ordered a very large order and everything was hot and ready all at once. Thank you time square for making my Father's Day. Everything was excellent as well.
Happy hour is a great deal. $1 pizza slice. Can't beat it.

Really nice place at first glance it tools like a truck stop food area but once you are inside its nice and cozy!  The staff is great and my order was qucik. Foot was amazing and really good. Hoever for me and my friend it was kind of pricey. other then that i recommend it!
Absolutely delicious! They accommodated a large group with a smile, served delicious authentic Italian. If you haven't been here, you are missing out. The Steamers are a MUST!!!!

Heard it was great......and it was. Both my friend and i got pasta dishes but I've heard their pizzas and breakfast are awesome as well. The place was packed but the servers kept on top of things. Best restaurant of I've tried in the north west valley so far.    Great place for a casual business lunch.

Tiny little gem of a place.   I hesitate to give it five stars given how few menu items I've actually had, but the ones I have had are bloody good. The pasta giovanni is absolutely freaking outstanding. Despite the large portion, every time I feel compelled to keep shoveling it down until the plate is clean.   The fried mozzarella appetizer is good too. I was expecting those stupid sticks that come as appetizers everywhere else. Instead, it was a nice, large piece of cheese that looked like it was covered with the batter from fish n' chips.   I've yet to have the pizza, although walking by tables with it, it does look promising. Once I go an convince myself not to have the giovanni, I'll give it a shot.

I am really disappointed that you are closing on Mondays. We will miss our meetings for lunch as well as your tasty lunch menu items. 1 star because you are closing on Mondays. We will miss Teresa a bunch

Great neighborhood pizzeria!  Friendy folks, good service but the food is what keeps us coming back.  The gnocchi is sooooo good, eggplant parmesean is excellent.  We have never had a bad meal here and have been going for about 2 years.  Try it you will like it!

My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place last night. Neither one of us had ever heard of it and decided to try something new. I'm so happy that we ended up driving past this place and decided to go in. Everyone is so polite and our waitress Christian was seriously the greatest. She was on top of everything and super sweet. The food is absolutely to die for. My boyfriend and I have decided that this establishment will be a regular place for us to eat. We will definitely be going back for years and years to come!

I came to this restaurant after it was recommended to me from a big auto mechanic with a large belly.  Since I'm not from the area but I was pretty hungry I figured it was safe to trust someone who eats a lot.  From the outside it looks like a used car lot but once you get in and try the food you'll realize none of that matters.  My dad and I ordered a house salad to start- which was pretty good nice variety of greens and veggies.  For my entree I ordered the scampi a limone.  The white wine based sauce was was really well- balanced.  I thought it was delicious.  My dad had the chicken parm and  that was good also (I had a few bites).  For dessert we had the cheescake and the creme brulee.  I have to say I don't even like creme brulee but his was really tastey!  Even though we went on a busy Friday night our servers and bussers took really good care of us.  We were always looked after.  I would definitely go back.

Time square is very small mom and pop type of restaurant! There is not a ton of seating inside but the food here is excellent! There always seems to be a wait at dinner time! They make a ton of unique dishes! If you like pasta, pasta seafood, and pizza this is your place! The pizza has excellent sauce and crust! Spaghetti and meat balls are delicious! Manicotti was scrumptious! Sandwiches are large and filling! I haven't found anything here I don't like here! They also carry a few unique beers that other restaurants don't carry!
Love this hole in the wall. All their food is awesome.

I can not tell you how many times I drove by this place thinking that a converted 7-11/Circle K could not be very good. The food is absolutely top notch. Now that I am addicted to the place I have tried almost all the sandwiches (try the Phili) pastas, soups, salads and pizza.. Same friendly staff who recognize you, always getting you a fresh coke or ice tea.. they have bar as well and serve interesting beers on tap. You will not be disappointed with this place.

We came in for brunch. We ordered a couple of the Italian Super subs with ham, salami, capicolla, pepperoni & provolone as well as an omelet, and biscuits and gravy. The subs were great! Nice amount of meat to bread ratio and it was all very fresh. The omelet was good and the hashbrowns were top notch - nice and crispy. The biscuits and gravy were the weak link, we'll skip those next time. Overall, friendly service and the eats are priced right. I'd happily return.

Have not been disappointed here, the more we try the more we like it! Appetizer steamers in garlic wine sauce yummmm! best fettuccini alfredo, wings, pizza and subs!   Get there early, they fill up fast. Heard they are opening new location 7th st & Union hills in the near future.
The pizza I thought was just OK, but the star here is definitely the pasta dishes.  Some of the best I've had!

Awesome place!  They are opening another location on 7th Street and Union which is closer so yay.  They are a key player in our take out rotation as well ad they are always super fast with our orders..
Loved the calamari and the service was wonderful. Very good family style dinner. You cannot go wrong.

LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!!  The food is freshly made so if you don't like mushrooms order the sauce without mushrooms...  In 3 years we've been coming here we have NEVER had a bad dish.  And take out is just as good and fresh...  NEVER cold and so so AWESOME.  And you can't beat the prices on these great dishes.  Everyone is super nice and helpful.  We tell them my husband has a seafood allergy and they make sure he doesn't get any cross contamination since they have many seafood dishes..

First time to Arizona. First time eating out here and i was not let down. Times square for breakfast was fucking fuego!!!! Bomb eatz!!!! And all that jazz. Bacon was cook to perfection and french toast was off the chain! Sorry no pic. Ate my food to fast

I have worked in restaurants for many years, and I've been in Time Square enough to take note...they are consistent in food quality and in service and that's a winning combination every time!  A very picky relative from NY/NJ area stayed with us for 5 days, we got food from Times Square 4 out of 5 days during her visit. If you could understand the extreme of her likes/dislikes, you'll surely realize that there couldn't be a better endorsement of how excellent the food is!

Love this place, best I Italian I've had in Arizona, Mediterranean salad is to die for, the Calamari just perfectly done! Today we had Cesar salad. Pizza, Fettuccine toscana. Tortellini de Angelo, meatballs and favorite of all, RED SAUCE!! I would normally take pictures, but my kids were ready to eat and devour the food Lol!! I will post next time we come, try it! Will be so worth for your $$, happy eating.
The food here is amazing and the workers are very friendly. This is my go to stop for Italian food. This includes the pizza and the pasta.

The Mahi Mahi is the best I've ever had. It is grilled to perfection with a mushroom piccata sauce either regular or creamy with or without capers. Delicious with the pasta side or steamed veggies. It also comes with aside of lightly cooked spinach accented with roasted garlic. A must if you like seafood.

This place is nice for a quick bite at lunch, or a sit down dinner. The servers have always been friendly, the food is outstanding (I think I may be addicted to their garlic bread, just sayin...) Overall if you're in the North Valley and you want some Italian food, I'd recommend it. It's got it's own character, part restaurant, part bar, all good.  The portions are big, I usually wind up taking something to go because it's too much and decent prices :)

The pizza here is pretty good. I would have given 4 stars but I ordered the fried mozzarella and was disappointed. It was rubbery and bland. I would definitely order pizza here again as that was tasty.

Love this place! And so do tons of other people, it's always packed!! Their pasta and sauce are amazing, maybe it's because there is a bit of heat in the sauce and I love Italian food with a bite. And it's all homemade pasta and bread too!
Fantastic Italian food made from scratch. Service was friendly and food was delicious. Try the mozzarella sticks, very delicious

My girlfriend and I love this place.  The food, service, and atmosphere are all excellent. I seriously cannot understand why anyone would rate this place lower than 3-4stars. To me, even on their worst night, they're still a 4/5. The only problem is; they can get super busy.. but for good reason!  I youre in the mood for Italian based food, try this place. 99/100 i am sure you will be fully satisfied.
A gem close to home! Love the friendly service & everything I've had is good. I can't wait to try the lasagna, no wait, the manicotti... ;-)

Was in AZ a couple weeks ago and was told about this place. Always up for some good food, so went to check it out. Not too crazy busy since it was midday. Our server was Teresa. Now service means everything to me. And I'm really glad she was who we got. Attentive, friendly, efficient. Knowledgeable about the menu and helped us make our selections. Everything was yummy! I will definitely come back to try more items off the menu. And hope we get Teresa again. She really did make our experience here memorable.
Good food, horrible service. Ate here for years, but staff and management have really gone downhill. I'm done with this place.
Pizza came out and the bottom was soggy; it was good but it was soggy. Women's bathrooms smelled like old fish. I probably won't be going back anytime soon.
I love this place i used to live within walking distance during my Years at MMI and this place make me feel like Im back East with family.   The Chicken Parmesan is a must

Went for lunch with my work crew...they were packed, but we happened to get a table immediately. We had 2 dozen medium wings as an appetizer which were delicious. I had the Mahi Mahi plate which was outstanding. I only had one issue, they stalled me out halfway through the meal because it took forever for anyone to check my drink...i take a drink after every bite, so when i have no drink i cannot eat either...this is a common thing for most restaurants so i am not going to trash the review over it.  finally got it and finished up, super full and satisfied.

I love this place.  The best Pizza on the north end PERIOD!  They have a great meatball sandwich, and the seafood is so good and fresh.  My wife always orders the muscles in red sauce.  Even the breakfast menue is great.  I hate writting a review about this place because I fear more people will start going there, but it is to good to keep to myself. The location is a little off putting but once you walk through the doors, it is all family.  The service is always warm and friendly.

I have worked in a similar type of restaurant for many years so I'm pretty burnt out when it comes to Italian food... but it's my husband's favorite... We generally eat out or order in every night a week separately due to opposite work schedules and have "date night" on Sundays. He decided on Time Square a little over a month ago. The bar was empty so we took a seat and about 30 seconds later the place was absolutely mobbed! We ordered a couple drinks and ended up moving to a table because it becameso busy that people were swarming us (my only complaint- they dont have much of a waiting area!) I was not disappointed with the small table off the servef station because I'm a lifer in this industry and I enjoy seeing how places do things and I'm an expert people watcher.... The bartender was helpng on the floor because every server was swamped and she actually ended up taking her order and answering questions and getting us refills. I actually kinda wish we would have stayed at the bar because she was such a cool chick but o was our server. They were both younger girls, the server had long blonde hair the bartender was brunette and just rad! Honorable mention to a cute,  male bartender we had last week he seemed really nice but we didn't interact much because he was busy with a crazy person- he served us perfectly and still had a smile(could have been fake, but it was nice ) and that's all I need to continue going there. The food was so good...... I just had take-out and that was my 4th time eating their food in about 16 days.. I CRAVE it. I work in an Italian Restaurant. This is unheard of! All I have to say regarding the food is : Sausage (any and all dishes), any pizza, mozz app, any. salad, chicken parm, gnocchi wasnt as delish as my work's but still yum, pasta with clams, any. sandwich, pesto, meatballs and creme brulee have all been awesome! I feel like I'm cheating on my job but they are 20 miles apart so it's okay
Love the food, it's always consistently delicious. My usuals are toasted pastrami (yum!!!!), calamari Caesar salad or a slice of pizza and salad. It's on the regular rotation for lunch. Check it out!

This is our second visit and it was just as good as the first.  We once again started with fried calamari since that is a favorite.   I had Ciopinno but had it with their spicy red sauce instead of just the plan red.  Absolutely delicious,  especially when dipping the garlic bread in the sauce.  Full of huge shrimp, clams, mussels,  along with white fish it was very filling.  My SO enjoyed fettuccine Alfredo with chicken and his plate was clean when finished.   We ordered a side of 2 meatballs with cheese for our 18mth old granddaughter and she loved it.  Of course she had already eaten calamari and garlic dipped in marinara.   We were too full for dessert so I am not sure of their offerings other than cheesecake which the people next to us were eating.  It's a fairly small place so you may have to wait a bit depending on when you go, but if you haven't tried it yet you should definitely make a point of visiting.
The service here? Some of the worst i have ever had. The food? Heaven. In a sea of terrible chain italian restautants, this dive is a gem. The pasta giovanni is dreamy!

Great service, nice restaurant, good quality good. I have been here one time with my family and really enjoyed the entire experience, enough to warrant a second visit at least. We will be back soon. Best part of the visit was the service by our great waiter.

My boyfriend took me here yesterday for lunch. Oh. My. God.  Two words: Pasta Giovani.  This dish was soooo freakin good. Pasta with chicken and sausage and mushrooms in this sauce that must be made from crack, because I could not stop eating it. It was absolutely delicious.  We shared the fried mozzarella appetizer. I expected a small square to be presented to us. Way off. For $5.95, we got a huge triangular serving of fried mozzarella with homemade sauce on top and parmesan cheese. It seriously was as big as a slice of pizza. And we loved it.   We also ordered the Mediterranean Salad, which was pretty good. Personally, I wanted to share the shrimp and calamari salad, but the boyfriend disagreed. I look forward to getting it at our next trip to Times Square.   Which will hopefully be soon. It quickly became a favorite after one bite. No lie.

This place has the best wings in town, hands down. Not sure where they get them but they are tender and very tasty! Place has been renovated not too long ago and is a full service italian/seafood restaurant in addition to a pizza and wings place. They also serve Moose Drool Beer (Missoula, MT). Outstanding food and service, including take out...
Killer Kombo Pizza ! Times Square New York Style Pizza is so good, it almost feels like it melts in your mouth, not in your hands

Never would have come here if it weren't for Yelp. Would've driven right past it, as it looks like an old donut joint. But don't judge a book by its cover. The food is amazing. Had the gnocchi - which is homemade - and swore I wouldn't eat the whole dish but did anyway. It was delicious. Even my pickiest child loved it. Pizza was great too. Prices are fantastic. Can't believe its been here 9 years and I've never been here! Closest thing to East Coast Italian I've had in Phoenix. Did I mention that's since 1997?!

Every part of their menu is fantastic.  Everybody I take there leaves stating that they will be back. They are known for their dinner pasta dishes. Okay, let me try that again, they are known for their sea food, I mean breakfast, oops I mean their Itallian Sub Sanwhich (served hot) holy cow is that amazing, or maybe it is their Osobuco. If you are there on a night when Moreno makes his amazing Veal Saltimbuca, prepare to weap tears of joy. We have been treated to so many great meals here and have alway been treated as family. Just go try it. The food is amazing. The people are great. They love what they are doing.
Can't say enough about this place! Delicious food! Best chicken parmesan! You gotta give this place a try.. Very cozy and friendly service always!
Our hotel concierge recommended this place and he wasn't lying! We had the shrimp limone and cannoli.. so good!

Love going to Times Square. Shea the waitress / bartender is always a joy to see. The best service we get anywhere! The food is absolutely incredible! You got to give this place a try you'll continue to go back

Nice restaurant tucked in North Phoenix. The times that I have eaten here the service shines the most. The staff are courteous, helpful, and genuinely are proud to work there. Pizza is quality and may be the best up in North Phoenix. This is definitely me and the wifeys go to place for sit down pizza in our neck of the woods. We will see you again!

Went there for breakfast with some friends and met with one of there buds who turned 21 and knew the place served alcohol no matter when....we were going for breakfast by the way. Anyways for a Italian joint the breakfast was pretty good. I had steak and eggs...didn't look like the picture but never the less. I didn't put ketchup on my hash browns, or sauce on my steak. The food was fresh and not greasy at all! It was cheap and just by the vibe in there i would go back for dinner anytime. Looking at the place from the outside you would never guess its a place to go. But go and take your family, and eat, drink, and love life.

I have eaten breakfast here in the past and it is very good. Great price and good portions. Last night was the first time I had dinner here and it was outstanding!!!! I had the tortellini d'angelo and I cannot wait to go back and have a repeat meal! After I enjoy my leftovers though!!! Great price and portion on dinner and garlic bread was delicious. We tried the bread pudding for dessert and I can't recommend that enough...Can't wait to return!
The best cheesesteak I've had in awhile & the service was fast & friendly. The cheesesteak was of epic portions so I could only eat half. Very pleased!! And the price was fair.

4.9 / 5. One of the best pizzas in Phoenix. Got the New York special and it was excellent. You have to eat it with a fork because the crust is very thin and can't support the weight of the toppings. The cheese is creamier than most. Toppings were very fresh and meat quality very very good. Not sure what they could do better. Definitely going back.

Times Square review  In search of the best pizza in Phoenix brings me to a lot of different places. Whether it is New York or Chicago, thin crust or deep dish, it doesn't matter. Last night we tried a place on a recommendation that it was the best.   Times Square Neighborhood Italian Restaurant at 2602 W Deer Valley Road is a must go-to place. You will be surprisingly pleased with your experience. We arrived at a little after 7 and the place was full but not packed. Seated in a half-booth along the back wall gave me a great view of all the patrons. Kari was our server and like a great server does, made us feel like we were regulars.   We decided to try a few different things off the menu and share. The Caesar salad is one of the best I've ever had. Lettuce was crisp, dressing covered the whole salad without making it soggy. I like that. A large meatball pizza and a steak sandwich.   Now let me tell you that I believe that a meatball pizza should have meatballs on it, not some crumbles of hamburger meat. This pizza not only was cooked to perfection but the meatballs were sliced just right and they didn't skimp on the either. Lots of cheese without being too cheesy. The crust was not too thin but not doughy chewy either. A really good combination.   Now as for the steak sandwich. Shaved rib-eye with good flavor, lots of mozzarella cheese and a good bread. I'd order this again in a heart beat. One short coming in my opinion is that the sandwich could have used some Worcestershire sauce on the meat. Kari suggested that she likes to dip it in the house medium wing sauce, so I tried it. It was OK but not for this. Reminder to self: Try the wings next time because the sauce was good!   There are so many variables for a restaurant to make my "regular" eatery list. Atmosphere, wait staff, cleanliness, etc. Let me tell you that this place has a bar, great atmosphere, our server was great, food was inexpensive (less than $35 for the two of us) and good parking. And yes, they are a biker friendly establishment. So if you're out riding and want a cold one and a pizza, try Times Square off of Deer Valley. They do sell pizza by the slice. Try out either location of Times Square. I recommend it. And tell them that Grumpy from Monkey Butt Radio sent you.   www.timessquareaz.com   Be good to one another.

This weekend I went for the first time to Times Square Pizzeria. This restaurant has amazing service, my glass was never left empty and my left overs were bagged up right away allowing me and my party to enjoy ourselves. I had the best scampi here. I can't wait to go back again, highly recommend!

Ate here for my brothers birthday with my family and had a great experience. The server was very friendly and managed to take care of us and all of his other tables without hesitation. Would highly recommend this place to others. Ask for Shay when you go in and you won't be disappointed.
Though the seating is tight and service can be a little iffy, the food is awesome!

I've been driving by this place on my way to work for about 3 years now. I finally decided to stop in with a recommendation from my neighbor. This is now my "go to" Italian place.  The restaurant itself isn't anything fancy, which is what I like. As long as it's clean (which it was) is all that I care about. My Dad and I stopped by on a Wednesday evening which the parking lot was packed (good sign). We were able to get a table in under about 10 minutes.  He ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo and I got the Tortellini D Angelo. Dad said that the Fettuccine was some of the best that he's ever had. My Tortellini was also delicious. You could definitely tell that the pasta was made from scratch. The service was also very good. I will definitely be back next time I'm craving some good pasta!

Their carry out service was spectacular.  I even called back after placing the order to add an entre I had forgotten.   Everything was ready when I got there and they threw in all the extras we needed to complete the experience.    I hate carry out, especially Taco Bell, and I was prepared to be disappointed.  They totally got the order right, food was hot and the pizza was amazing.    It was a little pricey but we ordered just about everything on the menu since there were several of us that were hungry after a day out and no one was interested in dining out.  The portions were good size and we could have shared.  The desserts weren't eaten until the next day and were really good.  Cheesecake with strawberries and double chocolate brownies.
Awesome service and food! And the place is so close to my apartment, which makes it even better and convenient to go often!

Great service-very polite waitresses! Timely drink refills.  Once we ordered the food is came out relatively quickly and fresh. We were a party of eight that ordered a variety of dishes. Everyone spoke positively of their meal. I ordered "Joes Special" which was two very flavorful garlic chicken breasts served with cooked spinach (a large helping).  No complaints from me as I was very satisfied all around. I would recommend this place for an Italian dinner that's not Olive Garden (though I personally like OG).

Time Square Pizza is a small dive off of Deer Valley and the 17.  It looks ran down from the outside but feels like a decent diner inside.  Ive had the veal parmigana, meatball sub, and cheese ravioli.  The best was probably the meatball sub.  The veal was lacking the flavors I was looking for and the cheese raviolis were good but not great.  I wouldnt mind trying a few more items on the menu.
5 stars. Feel I shouldn't say why and just do a mic drop and leave it at 5 stars. Go here and eat.

Woohoo! As good as it gets, is right.  I've been eating here, for almost as long as we've been in Phoenix.  I love going in this place, because it reminds me of my families restaurant, I grew up with, back in Central, Illinois.  I never have any complaints about either of their locations.  I like the ambiance, the food, the service and especially the servers.  Oh, and I almost forgot, the prices are very reasonable, as well.  I'm a sucker for Italian food, so I always look forward to going to Times Square.  I did say, that either location, is great, but I have a tendency, to point my vehicle, in the direction of the Deer Valley Road, location.  It's located just West of I-17.  There are so many good items on the menu, I have a hard time deciding what I want, when we go there, for dinner.  Lunch is different, so since I'm a creature of habit, I normally get the East Side Club or the West Side Club.  The East Side, is ham, turkey, roast beef, with provolone, and the West Side, is ham, turkey, bacon and provolone cheese.  I always order these two sandwiches, toasted.  The OssoBucco is very good, so is the sausage and pepper platter, and my favorite, is the Lasagna Casalinga.  It comes layered in noodles with meat, ricotta, topped with meat sauce and fresh mozzarella.        Well, It's 9 p.m. and now I'm hungry.  I think it's a little late to head over there, but I know where I'm eating lunch, tomorrow.  Don't pass up this friendly, neighborhood eatery.  Once you go in, you'll be hooked, forever.  This is my favorite restaurant, of all the places I eat, in the Valley of the Sun.

I've eaten at Times Square so many times it's hard to remember one particular blur of amazing Italian food.   I first tried their pizza and wings, it didn't disappoint. Stick with the medium wings, I enjoy spicy stuff, which they are not, however they have an addictive zing to them that beats any other wings I've had. You'll find yourself licking the sauce off of anything it drops on!! Pets beware!!!  I have yet to be disappointed by any of the pasta dishes. They tell me that all of their sauces are individual and made to order. I was impressed until I found them all to be addictive and incredible! (How boring, right!?)  Needless to say my repeated patronage speaks for the restaurants well deserved reputation.   Come try the amazing pizza and wings, come back for the amazing pasta dishes.  Breakfast is OK, lunch is amazing although I've only ever had the Italian super sub.   I only bring dates here when it's something special. I won't share this place with just any old broad. ;)
My Philly cheese steak was killer! The bread was so soft! But my boyfriends pepperoni slices were mediocre. The price is right at this place!

This place is close to work and a frequent go-to.  While I've never been wow-ed by the service, the food is really good. I'm a huge fan of their turkey sandwich - make sure to order it hot. It's actually one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. They also have good salads and amazing cheesy appetizers.

=====================BREAKFAST ================================  My sister Mindy, her husband Jon (visiting from Rhode Island) , my wife Carol and me stopped here for breakfast this morning. The place was not crowded so we were seated immediately.   Our server got us all coffee and then asked what we wanted to order for breakfast. Everyone's meals came cooked just perfectly. Our eggs were the way we all wanted them, they came out hot and in a timely manner.  FOOD: Reasonable portion sizes. The coffee was hot, delicious & fresh.  Our food arrived quickly. Not a single complaint from anyone. PRICE: The prices are just right. SERVICE: Service was prompt and friendly.CONCULSION: The food is affordable, tastes great and the service is excellent.   RETURN FACTOR: 100%.  ************************* What does my OVERALL rating mean?*************************  5 stars -Highly recommended.  I would be willing to drive out of my way to this business. It is that good. This place represents their industry or cuisine very well!  4 stars - Highly Recommended. I would frequent this business.  3 stars - Not that good but not that bad. Just average. I wouldn't mind going again.  2 stars - I would not recommend this establishment to friends or family.  1 stars - DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND DO NOT patronize this business. I would RUN AWAY from this place and you should too! DON'T WAST YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY AT THIS ESTABLISHMENT     .

Oh yes to the Philly cheese steak. They don't start cooking the steaks until 1pm for some unknown reasons, but otherwise everything about this Philly is very good. We always get the special loaded with onions, peppers and mushrooms. The fries are beer battered and taste better if you eat them hot at the store, but still worthy to-go. They are about $9 each, but you should be full most of the day.

We were told to try this place on Friday and we went on Saturday AMAZING AUTHENTIC ITALIAN the place is nothing fancy , but everything we had last night was delish. We had fried mozzarella cheese,  I had Scampi Fra Diavolo my husband had Pasta Emiliano and we ended with to die for again Creme Brulee  we shared the dessert,  but next time I'm not sharing!  Absolutely authentic I love anything Scampi and this one was perfect taste shrimp were nice and big. What else can I say we found our new favorite Italian restaurant.  We learned that if you are first time there look for items that in square boxes they are the popular dishes.  Will go back to try other dishes very soon. If not because of word of mouth we wouldn't have known about this gem!

We felt lucky to have found Times Square a little over a year ago. Recently our pizzas have been 30 minutes over their estimated pick up times, and under-cooked.  The last pizza's crust did not rise at all and was still doughy even though we requested the pizza be well done (crispy).  There seems to be a steady decline in area restaurants over the past 6 months in and around NPhx and Norterra as far as quality and service...this restaurant included.

I don't usually write reviews preferring to lurk. However, I feel that something is definitely up with all the recent positive reviews on this place.  Let me say that many years ago, my husband and I loved this place.  However, after last night, we will never frequent again.    I will preface with the previous time we ate there (and ate in) and the veggie pizza we ordered arrived with raw vegetables (raw and COLD) all over the top.  We sent it back thinking the kitchen was having an off night and thought no further of it until last night.    We ordered a pizza for takeout and I picked it up.  It was their NY pizza and we ordered it as listed with extra cheese and well done (regular crust).   When they brought it out, I looked at it first and I couldn't believe it.  The top was covered with raw bell pepper - big, giant chunks of it.  It wasn't even close to well done and I asked...this is well done?  The vacuous server said yes, that's well done (she didn't even look).  I said, the vegetables aren't even cooked and are barely warm.  Also, where's the extra cheese?  She and the girl behind the counter both gave me professional smile number 2 and said, it's there..it's well done.  I told them it would be my last visit and left.  They were not in the tiniest bit interested in customer satisfaction nor the quality of their pizzas.    I did take it home as it had already been paid for and (night before thanksgiving) had no other dinner options at the time.  But after getting it home, It got worse..the center of the pizza was wet.  I don't mean gooey, but wet like someone had spilled water on it.  We took what we could out of the box and cooked it on our pizza stone but suffice to say, it was not a happy experience.  Is this restaurant coasting on it's past?  I think so.  Will leave it to the sheople.

Decent food for the money serving sizes where ok but I was honestly let down by the cheese steak, DeFalcos of Scottsdale was way better and for the money hell even Jersey Mikes was better however my wife did say her pasta was good and my son loved their pizza and fries so over all I give them 4 stars not solid but hey they made it

This place is right next to our mechanic so it seemed an obvious choice to try for lunch after annoying adult vehicle expenses.    Inside, it's not much to look at.  But, I came the conclusion that they don't need fancypants glassware and matching chairs.    I ordered the margherita pizza - it was delicious but be warned, this is not your delicate gourmet pizza situation.  It was a lot more Papa John's than Sauce or Humble Pie.  Which isn't a bad thing - it's just good to know if you're expecting truck stop or fine dining.  My husband raved about the gnocchi and he's a tough cookie when it comes to Italian (especially since he makes his own gnocchi).  We shared the bread pudding for dessert.  Aside from the strange colored sauce (it was a yellow that is not found in nature), it was absolutely yummy.  It was the perfect amount of dense, gooey, and delicious.    Is this where you want to ask your girlfriend to marry you?  No.  Is it where you want to go for a cheap delicious meal before you elope to Vegas?  Maybe.
Great find!!! Little place that you could easily pass and not see it. Don't miss this place though cause really great food.
Food was very good, sevice also very good.  wife thought server was "totes adorbs ".lol

Good food with decent portions.  Definetly not the Olive Garden...I would say it's just as good as Anzios down on 28th drive.  I love it when the sauce is thick and sticks to the sandwich filling.  Wish they drained the pasta more but it was still pretty darn good. Menu is a manageable size and I heard they serve breakfast but haven't been in for that yet.  When I drive by on the way to work the parking lot is full for breakfast.

Family style Italian food with a great positive freindly service. Food is great with plenty of options to keep you coming back.        This time we had the Ny style pizza with fried mozzarella appetizer. The fried mozzarella isn't your typical fried sticks you find in most restaurants. They batter and fry a huge square of cheese and then pour the House Sauce of the top and sprinkle it with cheese. It was great the whole family enjoy the fried cheese app for 5.95.         Pizza was really good and cooked to perfection but  the pastas are what you need to come in and try. So many different pastas from traditional to family recipes and all of them are great.
Super good Cheese steak. Well everything I have tried is yummy. Looks like a dive but  worth a visit.

Consistent is good when it comes to a neighborhood restaurant. And that is what you can expect when you go to Times Square. You'll see the same servers and kitchen staff and they are always friendly. One of my new favorite pizzas is their vegetarian pizza. It is FULL of artichoke hearts, tomatoes, mushrooms, onions, and peppers. Absolutely delicious. Must admit, I am not a fan of their lasagna. They add a dash of a sweet spice to the sauce or meat, I think its nutmeg, and it just doesn't work for me. If you want breakfast, you must go there! I love the breakfast combos...my fave is the 2-eggs, potatoes, bacon and sausage. I think it is the #6. Always yummy and hearty. The home fried potatoes are my favorite. They cook them up with peppers and onions.  They always have some great beers on draft at the bar, too. (Hubby goes early when he has to pick-up a pizza so he can try one. I think Moose Drool is one of his fave's.) If you are in the Deer Valley area, stop by and give them a try. It could be your new neighborhood hangout!

The other reviewers aren't lying: this place is truly an easily overlooked gem in the Phoenix area.  It's certainly not much to look at on the outside, but as soon as you walk in, you can smell how good the food is going to be.  Truth be told, the head chef caught me sniffing the air when I arrived, and laughed a little when he saw the big grin split my face.  The menu is expansive.  There are pizza, sandwiches, calzones, seafood, and various pasta dishes.  I had the pasta Giovanni, a combination of sausage, chicken, and mushrooms with a tomato cream sauce.  Full and flavorful, as well as perfectly presented, I had a hard time not just devouring the whole thing.  My friend had the linguine special with sun-dried tomatoes and spinach with olive oil.  It was a far more subtle dish, but no less wonderfully composed.  The dish was not overly oiled and spinach tasted delightfully fresh, always a plus with spinach (the frozen stuff sucks).  As we started to slow a little, the chef came over with a plate of bread pudding for us to try.  Now, I'm not a desert person normally, but this was wonderful.  Far more savory that just sweet, light and fluffy.  A perfect final bite to end a wonderful meal.  It even turned out our server was one of the owners, and she told us a little bit about the place.  Throughout, she was very attentive to us and in no way overbearing.  Overall, this is a fantastic dining experience all around.  One of my best so far in Phoenix.

I was in town from Michigan and wanted some Italian fare. This place was amazing. Carrie was our server and she was great. She recommended the mozzarella appetizer and it was fantastic. From the craft beer to the amazing entrees we loved every thing. Great staff, great food!

This place is great until they get busy and then they fall apart ordered 2 subs and a side of meat balls at a total of 22 dollars for that price it better be fresh but it wasn't one of the subs was already done and sitting there for about 10 minutes before they started making the others one. both were hot I was quoted 10 minutes but at half an hour the order was still not done I got my money back but it seemed that they were not happy that I was upset about the whole thing left without any food plus the nachos I had purchased for my kids from another place was completely cold by the time I got home very disappointing evening. Went to subway afterwards and spent half that and it was fresh.

My 3 friends & I meet for lunch once a month on a Saturday, at a different restaurant each time. This is a special treat to ourselves. We like to eat our lunch & then, providing the restaurant is not busy, we remain at the table, socializing & entertaining ourselves with conversation. This month I suggested Times Square, having eaten here with family a few months ago. We arrived at noon & were seated immediately in a fairly empty dining room. I told my friends that this is what a mom & pop Italian restaurant back home in NY would look & feel like. The food was delish & the service was great, the waitress was very attentive, coming over numerous times to ask if everything was ok, but, I had the hot chicken parm sandwich & found that the small strips of chicken were sparse compared to the bread. After we finished eating, the table was quickly cleared & the check was presented. It was about a total of an hour from walking in to the restaurant. We just sat there talking & I am ever mindful of watching the customer occupancy of where we are, so that we are not taking away a table from another customer who is waiting. There were plenty of empty tables, so I did not say anything to my friends about leaving. Then I started noticing 'looks' being shot our way by the waitstaff. You know the look of 'why are they still sitting there?' So, we paid our checks, tipped our waitress, but, continued to sit there. Still plenty of empty tables. The 'looks' kept coming. We kept sitting there laughing & talking & the bus boy came over empty handed & asked if he could get us more water. If he truly was concerned about pouring more water for us, why didn't he bring the pitcher? We declined the offer & still sat there. More looks, still plenty of empty tables & no one waiting for one. Then about 10 minutes later, an older woman (owner? manager? both?) came over to the table & said 'Ladies I hope you enjoyed your lunch.' We all got the hint, got up & left. We were there a total of 1 1/2 hours, not bothering anyone, not monopolizing a needed table, not stopping a waitress from waiting a table & making money, digesting our delicious food, enjoying the homey feel of the place & enjoying each other's company & conversation. I thought that maybe it's the NY in me that felt as tho they had our money & were being pushed out the door,  but, my friends felt the same way. We have sat in other restaurants, under the same conditions, for much longer than 1 1/2 hours & the staff were always as polite as could be, refilling our water glasses without asking or being asked, even telling us to 'take your time & enjoy yourselves'. I can't say we will go back there.
We went to Times Square on a Tuesday night and the place was very busy and stayed busy.  Great food, good service, clean, not a great location.
The Italian good never disappoints, but I love coming to Times Square for breakfast! Nothing fancy, just good food. I enjoy the Eggs Benedict for breakfast and any of the pasta dishes for dinner.
Small neighborhood place with very authentic Italian dishes! The pizza is fantastic too! They have a large menu starting with breakfast. Definitely worth a try!
Amazing incredible awesome best eggplant ever! I always order for pick up and it's never taken more then 20 mins for them to finish the order. Highly recommended.

A nice mom & pop Italian restaurant in the North valley.   Phoenix is not known for Italian, but this place seems to ignore all that.  Great service from a loyal staff and really tasty options on the menu.   The pricing is not low, but based on the quality of service and food I think this place is worth the money.  The team hear keeps the place clean, which is always very important when in the food business.
Great chicken and veal dishes. Wife enjoyed eggplant.  Pleasant service, good menu, reasonable prices.  Terrific.
2 weeks ago was the first time I have ever been there, I've always known it was there but never stopped in. Great food, hard to choose from the menu because everything looks so great.
The only thing that's good here is the pizza everything else has no flavor, is very bland, low quality food.
Great place. Very friendly, great menu. Feels like a neighborhood restaurant. I will be returning!

My wife and I have been eating here since they have opened. The place is packed all day from open to close, that tells you how good the food is. Now we have a child and it is a great place for children too.   They have a nice small bar to get some drinks and best of all they have Moose Drool from Montana which comes from west Yellowstone where I first had this beer. And Times Square has it on draft.  They also serve breakfast which is amazing. I would recommend this place to everyone. It is a must try.

We affectionately call it the "Truck Stop" but you'll call it terrific! Just off I-17 at Deer Valley, it looks like it's in an old Circle K location. While they've done a very nice job the last couple of years to spruce it up, it's still lacks curb appeal. The food is wonderful! Some of the best sandwiches, pizza, and pasta in the NW Valley. While I usually go there for lunch, I took my wife there for a date night and she was very impressed with her meal. The service is always friendly and the prices are reasonable for the quality and quantity of food. I've heard the breakfasts are terrific but haven't made it there yet for that meal.

This is a a great little Italian place that I almost don't want anyone else to know about!  It has a very "family" feel to it, and the employees go out of their way to make you feel welcome.  I've only been there during dinner so I can't speak for breakfast but if it wasn't so far from my house, I'd be back in a heartbeat to check out breakfast.  The food was exceptional but the bread pudding is to DIE FOR.  You MUST try it while you are there.  It's the best.  They're also great about special orders so even if you're going no carb stop by, you won't be disappointed!  And check out the artwork on the walls too....hand drawn by a regular there.....maybe your picture will go up next!

We had the buffalo wings which were very good. They had a lot of meat and and have a nice zingy taste. We also had the NY Combo pizza Sicilian style, we were a group of 8 and had enough food for everyone. I would come here again.
I ordered to go but once I got inside it seemed like a fun place to be. Very mama papa, I still took my food to go but it was tasty. I would return next time in town.

WOW...to think we lived in this area for over a year before trying this spot out...shame on us. Hubby and I ordered fried mozzerella and ravioli which you would think is kinda plain or standard, but not here. I have been recommending this place to all my Italian friends saying this is hands down, the best. It is a cute mom and pop type place with ridiculously bomb food.

I always drive by but never know exactly what this place had to offer, now that I do I will certainly be a regular!   Tonight we ordered gnocchi for the kids, the mahi special for me, and tortellini for my hubs.   Everything was spectacular!   The place was packed and there were several people picking up orders to go. The wait didn't see long, we were seated right when we got in.   I can't wait to eat my left overs (and the boys' too)!

today I placed my favorite order to find out they are out of chicken fried steak. not only was this vexing but for the waitress to have no solution and take it as I didn't matter I rate this place a 1 star.  beware of this place limited supply on food and service very mediocre

This place has quickly become the only place I order pizza from when I crave pizza. It's a great upbeat place and has a great staff. Everyone here is friendly as is also very knowledgeable about everything in their menu. I love the menu as well as the bar drinks. I can't wait to go back.

Definitely the BEST pizza my family and I have ever had. Amazing service (so very important to us), and always clean and inviting. The prices are absolutely reasonable AND they serve breakfast!!! Ahhhh...I love this place. Only thing I would recommend changing is to please switch to fresh squeezed orange juice for the memosa's (concentrate is YUCK!), and to please add some chicken sausages or Turkey bacon for the non pork eaters:) change these things and I will add another review with 5 stars.  Definitely give this place a try though....it's our favorite neighborhood secret! Mmmm nom nom nom.....

Fairly decent place. Been here a couple of times. I'd actually ordered a meal a few days ago and logged into Yelp on my phone to read the reviews - pity I didn't read about the wings sooner! Anyway, I got the D'Angelo pasta - fettucine with mushrooms and a rather nice cream sauce. Other time I was here I got their italian special sandwich. Not too bad - nothing ultra-spectacular (I still prefer Mr Goodcents for sub sandwiches and my own home-made pasta to anywhere else's) but a decent lunch destination. Pasta was $12, add a soda and walked out of there $18 poorer. Bit steep for lunch. Sandwiches of course are a bit less expensive. At lunchtime the place was actually quite full - the seating technician advised that there was a tiny table up the back but I was there with one of the other dudes from work and didn't really feel like getting that close up with him, so we sat at the bar.  Service was great, food came out quick, was fairly tasty, sodas refilled quick (we were at the bar, duh). I'd get take-away next time - it's just expensive enough for me to prefer not to have to pay the extra $ for a tip. Not with gas prices the way they are.  I'll probably go back maybe once every two weeks or so. It's just a-ight far as I'm concerned. I may upgrade my rating after my next visit if the wings turn out to be as good as Luke S. says they are. Doubtful they'll top the wings at Uncle Sam's, though. Their sub sandwich sure didn't top Sam's all-American grinder which is my current favourite hot sub.

Food is great . Breakfast, lunch and dinner you can't go wrong. The only thing you need to known is stay away from one waitress that is so rude her name is Carol. God forbid if she don't like you,there would be no refills on your drinks or if you want to order take out for for kids,not going to happen. I even had to ask another waitress for our bill from her. All the other waitresses are sweet, but Carol avoid her at all cost. The last time we was in there she was so rude and we have not been back and don't known if we will because of her.

I have eaten here multiple time and tried various dishes.  I thought that their pizza was just ok, but crave the Pasta Giovanni; the sausage and demi-glaze really make this dish stand out.  Their cheese steak sandwiches are also excellent.  This place always seems to be busy and loud, but it only takes a few minutes to get seated.  The good food and service balance out my nits, so I would recommend this place to my friends.

Great little homemade Italian restaurant hidden at deer valley near I-17. Delicious pasta recipes, seafood, pizza and wings. Their cannolis for dessert are my favorite - filled with sweet cream and chocolate drizzle! It can get busy...they're a small restaurant

This place is super yummy. It kinda looks like a dive from the front, but it is really good. Their breakfast is so dang good... if you are going for dinner, I would recommend the Linguine Princepessa. It is fabuloso! Their bread is amazing, but the service... its either hit or miss. Seems to be a fave place for the locals!
Having a great time with the family and I've gotta say this place is great and food is soooooooooooo good people.

Decided to take family there for dinner. Passed this restaurant so many times but never went in. So glad we did. My son devoured his calzone.  Other son loved his pasta with sausage.  My husband and I had great meals. I'm Italian so I know good Italian food.  This is worth a stop.  It is a small family owed type place. It could use a little remodeling but fine.  Terrific service. They turned over the tables pretty quickly.

This is a great place for Italian food, different than those giants,  like Olive Garden. Their pizzas are good New York style and reasonably priced.  But what I LOVE is their Tortellini D Angelo --- OMG that tomatoe cream demi glaze is to die for!!! Hubby has gotten the lasagna, Ossobuccu and loves both. They have pasta dishes,  veal, chicken, beef,  shrimp, eggplant, mussels,  sandwiches, soups and salads. We haven't tried desserts as we are just so full from the yummy dinners. The only one we have gone to is located on Deer Valley Road,  they have another location on E Union Hills.
