Awesome!!  The food, service, and atmosphere were amazing. It didn't look like much when we drove up, but I'm so glad we tried it. It was very reasonably priced. Everything we ordered was delicious - the calzone was yummy and the Alfredo was great!  I definitely recommend this restaurant and I will go back when we are back in town.

Yelp helped direct us to this great place. We live in Chandler but needed to be up in the northwest valley for the monthly Chicken Math Club meeting. It is small but well-decorated and comfortable. The waitresses all help each other and are very friendly. We ordered the calamari to start and it was very good; tender and lightly breaded. We also ordered the Sicilian pizza with everything on it. It took a while to come out but worth it. The crust was thick and buttery and the sauce was beyond delicious! Our only reason for taking one star away was the center of the pizza was a little soggy. Almost like it was't cooked enough but the toppings were all fresh and so good. We ate it up and the next day, it heated very well on a stone in my oven. Delicious to the last bite!

I have been to Times Square many times and to both locations now.  No matter what I order, i always find the food to be amazing.  My all time favorite has to be their cioppino. If you have not tried it, you are missing out.  I enjoy cioppino to begin with but despite having traveled to east and west coasts, i have not found an equal for the delicious stuff served here.  If you don't enjoy sea food, you pretty much can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  Cheers.

We come here for breakfast regularly on weekends. It is usually pretty busy, but that doesnt hinder our service or wait time! Great prices, portions, and service.   Our usual waiter is such a sweetheart. The middle aged blonde, I wish I could remember her name! The other waitresses we get are also very nice. Great family owned buisness.   They always make sure my coffee is full and dont give me strange looks when I ask for a basket full of the french vanilla creamer instead of the plain stuff. One day when we were in a hurry, I only had time for one cup of coffee vs. the usual 2/3 cups. I chugged the last of my cup and the waitress noticed I wanted to keep drinking it, and came back with a to-go cup FULL of hot coffee! Perfect timing, that left me very happy. Great +1!   Only complaint would be from my friend who gets over-medium eggs (what does that even mean?), who says they arent always cooked correctly. I get mine scrambled, you cant screw that up, theyre always yummy!   Great little restaurant :)

New experience today. Lasagne was a nightmare, steer clear of it. Unless you like undercooked noodles, which are then over baked during the final preparation, which made it end up tasting like rubber, and a bad shade of gray-brown noodles was enough to turn my appetite off. Layers of noodles were basically stuck together that i mistook them for artichoke hearts. This dish should be fork tender and delicious. Instead it was tough, and horrible. Almost as if it was prepped days ago and left uncovered in a cooler like it dried out. Seriously nasty!  To top it off, nobody asked why I barely ate any of it. My review of this restaurant below still stands.   I have usually had very good food here.  Today was no exception!  I had been in a few "ruts" lately with their menu (Chicken Caesar and Antipasto Salad are both awesome) so I had the Chicken Breasts with Marsala sauce. The waitress recommended having it with the marsala sauce over the pasta side too instead of the marinara. Good call as the sauce is rather thin and would've blended in anyway. So it was good to break out of the rut and expand the horizons.  Tip: get there early for lunch as they only have about 15 tables max so they fill up fast during the lunch hour!

This place was a great find.  It came up on my Google maps search of restaurants on the way to Prescott from Phoenix.  The food was fantastic!!  We had the osso buco was amazing.  The meat was so tender and moist and the sauce was so rich and flavorful.    The bartender recommended an Italian wine and they had a good selection of craft beers as well.  The prices were very reasonable and I will definitely go back when I'm back in the area.

This is a place that we have enjoyed for years, but, as of recently, we have had some bad experiences there. I don't know if this is new or old, rules, rules, rules!! When ordering the Chicken parmesan, I asked for angelhair pasta instead of the penne that it comes with. You would think, simple, but nooooo, there is no changing the pasta on ANY item. come on, how silly is that. How much effort is it to make a customer happy. Ok , then, one day I ordered a sandwich to go, phoned it in. Upon arriving to pick it up, I saw my kids there having lunch, so I thought I'd join them. I informed the waitress that I have a sandwich that I ordered, and wanted that. I was told if I have a to go order, I cannot sit down and enjoy it.\ Seriously!!! With so many restaurant choices in the valley, you would think that this restaurant would do whatever it takes to make the customer happy. So, Time square might be busy and doing well now, but, one day they might not be with such harsh rules in place

The pizza here is good. Everything else is so, so. DO NOT ORDER THE ANTIPASTO SALAD! It gave me food poisoning. I've never been so sick in my life, and obviously we haven't returned since. Oh, and the owner was so rude to us when we came in with a stroller. (We walked there since it's less than a mile from our house.)

Chicken parmesan might be the best pizza I've ever had! This place was recommended to us by our hot air balloonist Jon from Apex. It appears to be a simple diner, but it will amaze your mouth with the tasty Pizza!

Finally tried this place after a couple friends recommended it to me. My husband and I went on a Friday night so it was busy; we got in just in time to take advantage of some happy hour specials. We each ordered a couple slices of pizza and then we shared a chicken caesar salad (plenty to share). Top it off with a couple of beers and we were out about $20.  Even on a Friday night the service was very quick and our waitness was nice too.  I did inquire about their wines availalbe since their menu only listed 3 of them... for an Italian restaurant I was expecting a better selection; they didn't even have a Zin on the menu (they had a white Zin, but to wino's like me that doesn't even come close to counting as a real wine). Ah well, I may have to be a to-go customer and take the food home to enjoy it with my own wine selection. If you are not a wino like me and you enjoy some wine basics like Robert Mondavi, the grocery store selection, then the selection might be fine for you.  I will still go back despite the lack of wine selection becasue the food was good and at a decent price. I'd much rather give my business to a privately owned place like this vs. other big chains so it gets my thumbs up!
LOVE this place for dinner! Just tried the breakfast and it's just as awesome! We had the chorizo and eggs Saturday special and the "BB" biscuits and gravy. Bloody Mary's too. Excellent!

Stopped by for the first time today as we were in the area and like to try new places to eat. Service was excellent..Shay made recommendations and was friendly and attentive. Menu was large ...meals were tasty and and portions were ample as we took some home. We will definitely stop back next time we are in the area and would recommend it for sure!

Real mom and pops restaurant! Reminds me of when my parents would make me super delicious food. They have the best bruschetta, and the most amazing SUPER Philly cheesesteak. The servers seem happy to serve you and usually no waiting time. Been there twice now, and needless to say I will continue these adventures

My husband and I love this place! We happened by it when we lived in the area and we still go there when we are close by. There is nothing extravagant about the place EXCEPT the food! Its a small italian resturant that seats maybe 30 to 40 people. There is usually not a lot of people so there is usually only 1 waitress/waiter. The decor is nothing to write home about but the pizza and pasta are exceptional. Pretty much anything on the menu is good! Portions sizes are big enough so you have some to take home and devour later! They also have great breakfast! All the prices are reasonable or at least they were the last time we were there. If your looking for the "Mom and Pop" italian joint this is the place!

We decided to retry Times Square HOPING they'd be better for dinner.  We started with a glass of wine. My husband ordered the Malbec so I decided to have the same. I found it undrinkable so I pushed it aside and drank water.  They feature many chicken dishes on the dinner menu so I thought chicken might be a safe bet so I ordered the Pollo Ortega. My waiter told me I made a good choice saying it was about the best item on the menu. It sounded tasty and was described as sauted Chicken with Mushrooms in a garlic basil tomato sauce with spicy red peppers.   I soon receive two pounded flat dry pale (not browned at all) almost tasteless breast of chicken with a next to tasteless thin bland red oily sauce. sitting by nicely cooked spaghetti with that next to tasteless bland thin oily sauce and a big basket of garlic toast that tasted like 1/2 butter 1/2 plain cooking oil with some dry herbs sprinkled on that also was bland and oily.  There was nothing fresh tasting about any of the food I tried and certainly fresh herbs weren't used in either of our meals here.   My husband wasn't too thrilled with his Veal Ossobucco he said it lacked developed flavors and the fat wasn't cooked out and also was in a bland sauce.  For me this is a borderline one star rating but when I think about the review I did on 1-26-14 this is just a smidgen above it.  Dry almost tasteless Chicken in bland oily sauce.  1.5 stars

Horrible costumer service. Tried just chit chatting with the girl that was at the register (preordered 2 to go pizzas)... Never been treated so horrible. I walked out... Sad thing is this place has such good verbal rumors but I will never stand for being talked to like that.

Great mid priced, local Mom & Pop italian diner.  I had the $1 slice and $1 off beer on happy hour and it was great.  Affordable for families but loaded with good selections.  I loof forward to returning and trying the pastas - Bob J.'s review of the Gnocchi with spinach and bacon really caught my eye.  Didn't see it on the menu though.

I've been to Times Square many times.  Always great food & great service. I was disappointed tonight though.  I was trying to keep it light since we were eating late so I ordered the dinner salad (always good) & the crab cakes from the appetizer menu.  I should have changed my mind when our server said the crab cakes were good but they were the only item on the menu not house made.  Unfortunately the crab cakes were AWFUL.  They were mushy, definitely not fresh.  They are so NOT representative of the rest of the food served in this restaurant!  If they can't make them fresh, then they should remove them from the menu.  On a good note, my husband got the clams & linguine and it was delicious!   We'll be back, but surely will not get the crab cakes.

Go here. Seriously. I have never had Italian food as good as this! We ordered the pollo Marconi and the pasta Giovanni and both were amazing. They had the same orange sauce (Demi glac according to their menu) and it is delicious. I could drink it like soup. I don't know exactly how to describe the taste because I've never had anything like it before- just amazingly delicious. The pollo Marconi is chicken with eggplant, ham, and tomato on top and covered in that delicious sauce. I don't think I can come here again without ordering this dish! The pasta Giovanni also was equally good. It had yummy sausage and mushrooms and again... that sauce. I'm drooling just writing about it. We will be back again, and again, and again...

Visited this restaurant Wednesday evening and it was very noisy.   The pizza and wings were good although the pizza was not thin crust and we would have preferred.  There was no wine list and the draft beer selection was just ok.

I LOVE their French toast!! Breakfast is served here, too. My friend and I have met here for breakfast every Friday while school is in session. The server is very friendly, and makes sure our coffee cups are filled. Breakfast here is a wonderful start to the weekend. I look forward to eating here every week.
The fried mozzarella was gross, but the spaghetti was pretty good. Wish this location was larger. If u go at the wrong time the wait is long.

We ordered some take out pizza and wing's of course. I do not eat wings but I asked specifically how GOOD they were so this was just the popular consensus from "the guys" that the wings were very good and hot but NOT better than Kelly's Grille wing's they still boasted that theirs are still KING so check my review for Kelly's if you want wing's.   The pizza: mine was just cheese a little over cooked and not crispy. Eh! Maybe if it served there its better?? Any who, I plan on going back  minus the pizza and wing crowd for some dinner. They did get New Times Reader's Choice Best Neighborhood Italian in 06. If that even means anything here, anyway I will update soon.

This place is amazing.  Awesome staff, great eats and cheap drinks.  My advice is order what you like and you will not be disappointed at all.  One last thing safe room for dessert.  The brownie for 3 bucks is enough for two people.  Hey what can I say I am cheap, but I like my good eats.

Kristie is an excellent server she sees us pulling into the lot and she puts in our order as she knows what we have every Sunday, She is just great and friendly, The only think I would like to see is sugar free creamer. Food is great too,

I tried the bruschetta at another Italian place in PHX and it just made me crave the bruschetta here at Times Square.  The bread is perfect, the tomatoes are always fresh and delicious with the perfect amount olive oil and balsamic vinegrette.  My wife got the Gnocchi and it was definitely not the shrink wrapped Gnocchi, it was made fresh and super delicious.  I got rigatoni with vodka tomato cream sauce with sausage, chicken and mushrooms.  Needless to say I was not disappointed.  Wait staff was super friendly and service was quick but you were not rushed.  Wish there were more stars i could offer as this Italian restaurant is definitely one of the best in Phoenix!

Food is so so..Breakfast specials are cheap but I'd like more than one piece of french toast than just the lonely one on my plate...it's only bread.. our sausage patties were gross..my eggs were cold but hashbrowns were hot? Alexi's on 19th ave and Union Hills is breakfast done proper..old school..I will say that the staff at Times Square were nice and attentive but We're not goin back

The Ensalada De Mare is AWESOME!! The Pizzas are AWESOME! The Pastas are awesome! The subs are AWESOME! The service is awesome.   Very clearly, the place is AWESOME!! I frequent here a lot!!   My favorite restaurant in this part of the valley! Keep up the great job Times Square! Mad mad props!
The Giovani is to die for and the garlic bread is always generous! The servers are very friendly and the place gives off a sort of hometown vibe. Always my first choice.

We had a little bit of trouble finding the place, I did not realize it was East of 27th Ave., North side of the street. Friend had pizza, hubby had I think chicken marsala, or pasta with chicken marsala... and I had a delicious calamari salad. It was very good, seemed small at the beginning but it was plenty, and it was very lemony. I enjoyed it a lot and will probably keep ordering it every time I come here. We came here for lunch during the week, they were kind of busy and service was good.

Everything here is home made. (Well restaurant made but you get the point ) sauces are delicious and not some canned  stuff you can get at any chain restaurant. Fried mozzarella as appetizer is fantastic and will ruin all other fried mozzarella for you. I have had the lasagna, osso bucco and chicken something or other entrees. Every one of them was outstanding. Their cannoli's were among the best I have had. Overall, if you are looking for a non chain that is great- this is the place for you.
Food is always great, nice little local diner and no wait time on a Sunday morning at 10Am. Excellent friendly service too.
Had pasta dish their specialty was good. Dinner salad dressing was weak just tasted like oil not Italian. Took pizza home not good. Doughy and under cooked

We went to Time Square Pizzeria on a Saturday night. While it was later than normal for a busy dinner crowd (about 8:00pm) we got seated right away. The place was packed with couples, families and just a ton of people. Due to it's size (pretty small) and the amount of people dining it was quite loud but that was fine.   We had the Clams in Linguini with a white wine sauce and the Lasagna. The orders came out also with garlic bread. The Clams and Linguini was very tasty but I was hoping for some more clams on the dish as it didn't seem like a lot for the price ($14.95) but the lasagna was huge ($10.95) and very good. It had a ton of cheese (which is what I like) and came out piping hot.   While sitting waiting for our dinner I did view all the different dishes, pizza's and desserts that when by and I think I spotted what I might try the next time I visit.   Overall, everything was very good and I will be back to try a few other pasta dishes for sure.

Time Square is a surprising hidden gem in North Phoenix.  I love that they always seem to be improving either the exterior or interior.  Right down the road from the Motorcycle Mechanics School, there are frequently some cool bikes out front.  Great pizza and Italian food, they ALSO have a wonderful breakfast and if you get here before 9:00 am you can get $3.99 special....I LOVE the homefries.

We were really looking forward to trying this place. The food is so-so. Doubt I'll be craving it. We had ziti, fettuccine Alfredo and linguine principessa (shrimp and clams). The shrimp was rubbery. Garlic bread was good but gets hard as a rock if you don't eat it asap. (Microwaved??) The walls had spots where paint was rubbed off. I can honestly say the waitress was arrogant and made us feel like she was doing us a favor by serving us.

Went here twice while on a work trip. First night we had the pizza which was not amazing in my opinion, but I had the Italian Super Sub the next day and I am still craving it. I got it without capercolla and mayo. It was perfection. If I ever return to the area I will be eating here again just so I can get this sandwich. I did not try the pasta, but it looked good. I would maybe try that next time as well.
Local, independent place. Comfortable, nothing fancy but very tasty food. Got food to go because wine choices are lacking. Very large portions, wish we had split a portion.

Previously I reviewed the great breakfasts here. But really the lunch and dinners are to die for. This is the best Italian in the area. Pollo Marconi with chicken breast mushrooms eggplant ham covered in a demi glaze sauce is my fav. Yet they also have great deal dishes including ossobucco for great prices. Today having Philly cheese steak with mushroom peppers and onions. Place is busy so come early.
Really good. Everything from scratch. House dressing is great on the salad. Definitely going to be coming back. Pizza also great. Had the Margarita Pizza. Wait staff was really friendly as well
Best Italian in Glendale that I've found.  Seafood flown in daily.  Reasonable prices.  Good food.  Friendly service.  May be a short wait for seating.  You won't be disappointed

So thankful to live close to this place! I give it 5 stars without hesitation. A classy neighborhood hangout with amazing Italian dishes. Everything I've had on the menu was delicious. Portion sizes are filling, soft warm bread to munch on, and the staff is friendly and very knowledgeable of the menu. Even the pizzas are to die for. The seafood dishes are my favorite. Whenever I have guests visiting from out of town, I always take them here and it always ends up being a favorite. I'll be back soon!

My family and I have visited this place numerous times. Every time was always a satisfying and fulfilling experience. Highly recommend this place as the food is excellent, good service and well-priced.

I have been back two times in the last 2 months. The slices were large and tasted great. Not Like Before.   I had a pasta dish (Chicken with red and white sauce combined) and while it was a tad boring it was executed as they said it would be, I guess I needed something with some kick that day. Still giving a 5 star review because they deserve it.   Lunch service is quick and servers can be fun.

I'm not a big fan of pasta, but I can't say this would be a place I would pick it I were.  Food is alright, I wouldn't be running and knocking anybody over for it.  I've had pizzas, sandwiches, and pastas here, but it just doesn't seem to come with a bang.  The decor is obviously, old luncheon New York style, but nothing too fancy for sure - bada bing!  Service is a rush here; I understand the place gets pretty packed, but can you slow down a tad bit and listen.  Oh yeah, the place can get pretty loud too!  Overall - the rating "I've definitely experienced better!"

This place is becoming our favorite Italian restaurant in the area!  Times Square Pizzeria is a wonderful gem to find in a city that has so many places to choose from. They offer weekly and daily specials, so remember to ask about them before par oozing their menu.     Food~ everything we've tried has been DELISH!   Some of my faves to recommend to you;  apps fried calamari and their antipasto salad are excellent.  In addition to tasting excellent, their portions are HUGE, so plan to share!   pizza; go for the NY Combo with pepperoni, Italian sausage, olive, mushrooms, onion and peppers.  Their Genovese pizza with grilled chicken, ricotta, pesto and mozzarella is also very good!   Pasta; go for the tortellini D Angelo ~ oh my!   Cheese stuffed tortellini in a vodka sauce with Italian dried and domestic mushrooms and chicken.  The rigatoni alla Laura and the pasta Giovanni are also great dishes!  You wont be disappointed.   Seafood; we like the Cioppino and Pescatore!  Both are very good!    Restaurant~ this place is kind of small and in an area of north Phoenix you may not have been to before but they are worth the trip!  Their restaurant is very clean and lightly decorated.  They've made the most out of its size.    Service~ everyone's very friendly and eager to serve!  The kitchen doesn't seem to miss a beat and is very accommodating to even the most finicky eater.    The Times Square Pizzeria is a fantastic place for you to dine with family and friends.  They do get busy during the peak times for lunch and dinner so plan your time accordingly.  We hope to see you there soon!

My wife and I really love this place, they have great Italian food. The best part is the consistency the food always comes out great. I love the Linguini Prispesca it's really amazing.  I took my buddy there for dinner last night and he loved it so much he took his family to Times Square for lunch.

Met a couple of gal pals and a child here for dinner.   We wanted a place that was half way between our geographic locations.   Austin was our server.   What a friendly, professional, efficient person.    He made numerous suggestions as to drinks and appetizers.  He stated the fried mozzarella appetizers were the best.   I wasn't too keen about the idea since I don't especially care for fried cheese.   No, he stated, it was more of a flat cut of cheese, which is exactly what it was.  We cut it into our bite-size pieces and it was perfect.   The breading was tasty without that greasy texture and flavor.   After discussing and debating what we should order, I decided on the linguine principessa and my tablemates the pasta giovanni and another on the manicotti.   The child had the child pasta spaghetti alfredo.   A small caesar salad was also ordered.  I loved my linguine principessa.   It had a ton of chopped clams and a good number of the jumbo shrimp.   The cream sauce was perfect and the texture of the linguine was just the way I like it -- not overcooked!   Since I am not a fan of marinara sauce, I tried the manicotti.   Yes, tasted like baked manicotti with marinara sauce.   I didn't try the pasta giovanni.  John, the manager, took time out of his busy schedule to drop by our table to see how everything was.   We agreed that Austin was the best server, and told John to give him a raise.  I don't normally visit restaurants on this part of the valley, but if I have the opportunity to meet friends again for Italian food in NW Phoenix, I'll sure visit Times Square Pizzeria again.

I don't live in Phoenix, but I visit it often.  And with each trip, I like to try something new.  However, Times Square won me over and I have been back a couple of times.    This is a great local joint with a really unpretentious environment.  And you know what?  It doesn't need it.  The food and service makes up for the basic interior.  I will say that you really need to try either the Pescatore or the Pasta Giovanni.  Both are fantastic.  I swear they must come from grandma's old recipe box because they taste like they've been perfected over the years.   Both have amazing flavor.   The wine list is a tad small but they have enough to get the job done.    Everyone there is incredibly friendly and are happy to recommend their favorites.   Their prices are very reasonable for the portions and it's highly likely you will walk away full and happy.

Yes this place is popular.  I ordered pizza and wings.  both of these items were a complete joke.  i really couldnt either one it was ao bad.  i could get better wings at wingstop and thats really sad.  Never again!
Everything I've tried was cooked to perfection. Absolutely love this place. The staff is always attention and outgoing. The food is absolutely divine!!!

Awesome food and great prices. This is one of those inconspicuous looking dives that will either be excellent or give you food poisoning. Fortunately I think this is some of the best Italian food I've had in the valley, and at some of the best prices. Now, this isn't fussy Italian food, more like down home Italian cooking. Portions were huge and everything we ordered was delicious. Service was friendly, and it wasn't overly crowded on a Tuesday evening. I've heard that isn't the case if you come on a Friday though.

And the BEST Cannoli EVER, AND Bread Pudding and Creme brulee! Love the Chicken Philly and Calzone now, too! Love it with chicken, spinach and green peppers. tastes like my grandmas bread and the ricotta  and mozz is to die for! Side salad is Awesome, too!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

As a former Manhattanite I could not be more grateful to live within a mile of this fantastic restaurant. The atmosphere is welcoming, unpretentious, and the pizza takes me back home. I have been just about everywhere in Phoenix, homesick for NY style pizza. Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!! I stop by for a slice too often to reveal ;) If you are wondering about the rest of the menu....from breakfast to dinner there are so many  delectable choices that you could close your eyes and just point to anything on the menu and not be disappointed :)

This is my second review on this place! When asked "where do you want to go for your birthday dinner" one would think id say "Capital Grill" or somewhere fancy. Nope...all I want is my favorite pasta dish from Times Square :) Can't wait for Tuesday!
Fair.   Just so so.    Salad was ok.   Spaghetti with sausage (al paesan) was fine.    Margarita pizza very greasy but good.   Service was fine.   Won't rush back
Doesn't look like much, but this place was tasty!  Even our picky kids finished all their food.  Definitely going back!

This is a mixed review.   We have been to Times Square many times and the food is always amazing. This trip was no exception. The food is consistent and amazing. I truly LOVE this place.  That being said, we had TERRIBLE service this past visit. our server, Damion, was completely unnatentive. He took our order and then we did not see him again untill we asked an employee to bring us our check. no asking how the food was... no asking if we needed anything... no asking if we would like refills... it was weird.  We were there an hour and he literally did not come by once. maybe it was just a bad day for him.  We will absolutely come back because, in our 7 or 8 visits, this has been the only time with an issue.

Yum. I love this place. Super reasonable for breakfast and great lunch and dinner. Delicious pizza and wings. I love the penne arrabiata and I add the sausage. I really like arrabiata sauce and will try it at most Italian places and theirs is one of my faves. Can get crowded and busy. They have parking behind the restaurant. I do wish they had a better wine selection.

Great hidden gem. Great food and excellent customer service. It's family owned so they really care. They just opened a 2nd location at 7th st and union hills that is also good.   We love their pizza and wings! Pizza has lots of cheese and Wings have an amazing flavor with lots of meat on the bones. Best of all they make a homemade ranch that pairs well with the pizza. I have had other Italian dishes that are all good too.   Highly recommend for dine in, pick up, and large parties! (:

The food is very tasty. The Demi-Glaze sauce in many of the dishes is fantastic! Tonight we ordered take out. The pasta Giavanni and the egg plant parmigiana. The pasta giavanni has that terrific Demi-Glaze sauce with mushrooms, sausage, and chicken. The pasta is cooked perfectly and the dish is a must try. The egg plant had a great layer of melted mozzarella on top along side spaghetti with marinara. Both seasoned to perfection. They both come with a half a loaf of garlic bread, also delish! The only reason they don't get 5 stars is because of the service. Eating there is almost painful. The servers and cashiers need to be trained and nobody has any answers. You will wait to be seated, heck you will wait to be acknowledged. We have been getting the good to go as to avoid the poor service and enjoy the great food.
My philly sandwich is amazing!! The server/bartender/Togo/hostess is a rockstar! Everyone here is doing a great job at taking care of the customers.

Grace was our server and was awesome! I had the penne vodka with chicken but had angel hair pasta instead. That plate was cleared off in 10 minutes! Oh it was delicious. Especially with the garlic bread that came with it! Husband got sausage and peppers on angel hair pasta and cleared his plate too! This was awesome, especially since it was our first time!

Excellent Pizza, as expected from this small, neighborhood joint. Asked for a Well Done Pie and thats exactly what I got. Nice surprise to actually get something that you ask for, specially when you are blind testing a place.

Outstanding food.  My husband & I order take-out from here all the time.  During the summers, can't beat their deli-style sandwiches - they are packed heavy with meat & cheese (cold deli sandwiches are great for hot Phoenix dinners) - they must weigh about 1 1/2 pounds each!!!   You've got to try their gnocchi - OMG!  To die for.  I usually order a child-portion - again, you can get this to go and serve it at home as a side dish to your home cooked food.  I've also had one of their seafood pasta dishes - superb. Owners are so friendly - plenty of seating is always available.  Cute bar in the front when you walk in.  I've been going here for years.  It's a must-try (especially their gnocci).  I know they serve more than just dinner, but their dinners are wonderful.

Pasta is delicious however the space is quite small so hoping during peak times, you may have to wait 30min and there is really no where to wait other than standing in front of the door. I promise it's worth the wait though

I love finding amazing food in the pockets of the Valley where you wouldn't expect it to be there.  From the outside, this restaurant is easy to miss.  If you're a foodie looking for a decent place that can accomodate/ tolerate children, this is the place.  Their pasta giovanni is to die for...penne in a mushroom cream sauce with chopped chicken breast and italian sausage.  I've been here 4 times and the food is consistently awesome.  If you are a seafood fan, the cioppino and seafood salad (loaded with shrimp and calmari) are both excellent choices.  The best part of this place is that they can accomodate a customer craving pizza and wings with a beer at the same time they can accomodate a customer wanting oso bucco with a nice glass of wine.   In my personal opinion, Times Square is the most affordably delicious Italian restaurant in the entire Valley.

Favorite Italian restaurant in the valley.   We have tried a bunch of things and are always satisfied. Among the best things we have had are the Cesar salad, chicken parm, pasta baronessa and chicken Marconi.   The service is good, the restaurant is small and not pretentious and the food is always great.

They serve breakfast!!  Who knew? We stopped here on our way out of town. Wasn't too busy since we stopped in so early. The waitress was nice. Breakfast was good. Nothing fantastic. Eggs were cooked as asked. Bacon and toast we good and crispy. My friend got their biscuits and gravy. She said the biscuits were light and fluffy, not too dense. She said the gravy was good! It was a simple breakfast with no fuss.  Definitely a good place to go for breakfast in the area. Their dinner is way better!

West Sideeeeeee!!! I love this place and cant get enough. made to order canoli and hot west side sandwich are what dreams are made of for me. The staff is always super nice and the atmosphere is relaxed and chill. Next time I am going for the pasta!!!
We have eaten here a few times and my husband always gets something different. His dish is usually pretty good, but the spicy cioppino is hands down my favorite dish.
Hands down one of the best italian food places I've ever been to! They need to open more locations in the Easy Valley! I drive 45 minutes to eat there and come home. It's SO worth it!

I LOVE this place! We always get great service and the food is excellent! I really love the salads, they are so huge and fresh. All the appetizers have been wonderful. Pasta dishes are wonderful. Cannoli is on par with most bakery's in town.
We were visiting and found this on Yelp.  So glad we did!!   Food was so good!  Salads,  pasta, Pollo Marconi is to die for!

I have eaten here three times now and I'm willing to give it four stars.  It's good food, priced reasonably, with healthy options (Mi piace l'insalata di mare!) and low-cost sandwiches.  It is a good option for lunch or dinner.    Don't get me wrong.  It's not outrageously refined, exquisite food.  It's somewhat Americanized Italian, but the place still has some style and some more adventurous menu items.     For a sit-down place, they do a good job of getting you in an out at lunch time as well.  It's nice to have a sit-down, non-chain ethnic lunch place in this area.    I have ordered or tasted: - liguine with sausage and olive oil/garlic sauce  - insalata di mare  - Liguine with sausage and peppers - Puttnesca  I would give them all a B+.  I have not had the pizza, so I can't comment.  Soda is $2.25.  Just a heads up.

Our first time here! Had dinner with our kids on a Monday night. Place was clean and welcoming... Seated right away, server was attentive and made some great suggestions. Had medium wings with added garlic and Parmesan to the sauce (hot on the side to taste) and the Antipasto Salad. Both were excellent! Kids had Alfredo - which was very creamy and super tasty! Overall it was a fantastic dining experience and we are excited to go back! If you go in on a Monday or Tuesday for dinner, ask for Jeff. He was a great server!
Clean, friendly, great food.   The servers remember us, my favorite server calls us "kids." Plus, they accommodate special orders!  Get there for breakfast and Pasta Giovani for dinner.

The food here is out-freaking-standing. Hands-down the best Italian food I have ever had. The pizza is out of this world, and their mozzarella appetizer is indescribably perfect. Of course I wish all prices were lower, but the pricing here is certainly appropriate for the quality of their fare.   The only downside is that this place is TINY. Their reservation policy is a little inconvenient (reservations have to be placed before 3pm) so forget about getting a table in less than an hour if it's after 6 on a Friday or Saturday. Also they literally have 2 (three, maybe?) tables available for large parties, which can make it ever longer.  We discovered this difficulty on our most recent trip (our fifth) and the highschooler they had seating parties was unskillful and rude. We had to ask for the manager after we were still waiting half an hour past their 30 minute estimate for our seating.  But every other visit to Times Square was a 5-star experience so I will give them a slide on that one time. I was told they are working on opening another larger location, which would be great. Because it seems like they currently occupy a remodeled 7-Eleven (yeah, the building is that small.)  A Large pepperoni/mushroom pizza and a cold Moose Drool (beer) at Times Square is really difficult to beat though. Highly recommended--but don't go during peak hours or you'll have a bad time.

Absolutely delicious! We were looking for an authentic Italian restaurant to eat dinner at tonight and WOW did we find one! The food was superb, the service was fantastic and the atmosphere was perfectly cozy. Everything looked so good we had a hard time deciding on just one dish. I'd highly recommend the fried mozzarella, though everything we ordered was super tasty. It'll be hard next time we go not to get the same dishes, but we promised ourselves we'd try something different.   The location is easy to get to from anywhere in the North Valley, just off the 17 north of the 101. This is a great place for people from the West and East Valley to meet in the middle for a tasty meal.
Love the beer and wings and appetizers!! Great fun!! Great times....basketball and baseball going!

We now have a new favorite Italian restaurant. Great staff and excellent food. This place has a neighborhood feel to it. I was in a t-shirt and felt perfectly comfortable. The pizza and salad were fantastic. The place was crowded on a Tuesday night and when we left at only about 6:00 ( we like to eat early) there were 3 parties waiting for tables.   Love this place and am looking forward to taking friends there for dinner and drinks!

Just moved to this neighborhood and Times Square Pizzeria is my favorite restaurant in the area so far.  My girlfriend and I went there the other night for dinner and we split a margherita pizza and the Pasta Giovanni (ordered it with angel hair instead of the penne).  We were very impressed with both dishes!  Two night later, I find myself getting some Pasta Giovanni as a to go order.  We also went here for breakfast about a month ago for our first visit.  Great breakfasts at a great price!    Based on the amazing aroma of this place when walking in you can tell it is going to be good food.  I highly recommend Times Square Neighborhood Italian Restaurant.  I'm sure to be back again and again.

A tiny Italian restaurant that was bustling when we stopped in for dinner on valentines day.  Since the place was packed, the wait was about 45 minutes but we grabbed a glass of wine while we waited.  The menu consists of lots of authentic Italian dishes as well as pizza.  We tried one of the house specialties - creamy penne with chicken and sausage and a pasta with shrimp.  Their small Caesar salad was plenty for the two of us as a starter and the pasta came with 2 hoagie-bun sized pieces of crunchy garlic toast.  A great local spot.

OMG.  So good.  Seriously authentic italian food housed in what looks to be a former Circle K.  Sneaky!   I'll echo the Pasta Giovanni praise, but the real star here is the pizza!  Easily the best pizza in North Phoenix.  The wait staff are complete pros - not an ounce of ennui or arrogance.    As a result, this place fills up quickly in the evenings. Go early or be prepared to wait in the akward entryway or at the bar.

Saw this restaurant on Check Please. Great Caesar salad and garlic bread.  Very good linguini white clam sauce. Service was excellent and fast (almost too fast). As a single diner I had not finished my salad when entree arrived. Everyone was very friendly. Good portions for great price. Restaurant was very loud but that's because everyone seemed like family. Will be back to try a lot of other great looking options. Good Italian not always easy to find.

I had the chicken parm and he had the fettuccine primavera. We shared the calamari appetizer. Portions were decent size and flavors were alright. Calamari was nothing to write home about. The quality of the ingredients were only okay. Not too bad and not too good. We sat in a booth and the flies on the windows kept bothering us. Waitress was nice and helpful.  It took us a while to be seated. It gets a bit loud in there but it was tolerable. Will we go back? Probably not. It was filling but not the best we have ever had either.
Great eggplant parmigiana. Marinara sauce was really good. Service was prompt and polite. Atmosphere was really laid back and relaxing. Will be going again.

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. It's a typical Italian place you would see back east, nicely appointed, quaint. The food is very good, i ordered the mushroom ravioli, and I'm a picky eater. The cannoli was also really tasty. I recommend this place if you find yourself on  the west side and you're craving Italian!

This place is great!   I've eaten here twice now and both times the food has been wonderful.  I've driven by this place for years and it always looked closed to me.   The windows are very dark.   My husband's barber told him his customers (the barber's) drive all the way from Scottsdale to eat here.    We decided to try it out after hearing this and reading good reviews about it on Yelp.   The first time we went for dinner.  I had the Osso Bucco and my husband had Seafood Paella.   Both were great.  I've had  Osso Bucco in high end restaurants that couldn't compare to this.   The second time we ate here for lunch.   Husband had the Philly Cheesesteak with Peppers, Onions, and Mushrooms.  I had the spaghetti and meatballs.   I had some of his sandwich and we both agreed it was the best Cheesteak we've ever had.  The sandwiches are loaded with fillings and are not salty.   Spaghetti and Meatballs were good but I like Babbo's and Humble Pie's better.    I would have given it five stars but the atmosphere is not the best.   Our first waiter even told us they do have the reputation for being a hole in the wall.   The service is very casual with no sense of urgency.  On our second visit for lunch our waitress told us she had been there over five years and they have quite a few regulars.    Both times we have visited the restaurant was almost full.    Try this place out even though it is a "hole in the wall."

I found this place via the Yelp app as I was drawing my search for dining options closer and closer to my hotel (my resolve to travel was waning). The reviews looked good, so I headed that way.   Moving in, it's definitely a casual, local joint that probably isn't a destination for travelers, but that's OK. The tap beer selection is mostly typical corporate America fare, but I did snag a Blue Moon, which was served with the proper orange slice (and a pretty generous one at that). Looking through the reviews, it seemed that either the Pasta Giovanni or the Pollo Marconi was the way to go; my server suggested the former, saying it was their most popular dish. Done.   Upon arriving a the table, the dish was accompanied by a slice of lightly buttered garlic toast, which was crunchy and tasted pretty good, though it could have used more butter. The pasta was a generous portion, featuring "smooth" al-dente penne, sausage sliced on the bias, chicken, and mushrooms in a tomato cream demi-glaze sauce. The sauce was a little thin, but had a nice flavor, balancing savory with a tiny bit of sweet. A few of the chicken pieces seemed rubbery, and the rest were somewhat unremarkable. It was a decent dish, but didn't really stand out. I applied some grated parm and red pepper flake to pick up the pace a little, and that was a nice addition.   I also thought the dish was a little expensive compared to the ingredients and overall look and feel of the restaurant. But there are a number of options on the rather lengthy menu, so maybe a different dish would have suited me better.

Pizza is so-so....but the pasta dishes are so far above anything else in the area they are worth the five stars.  The wait staff is great-food is great and the beer is cold...nuff said.  Hate to even mention this little gem of a place as its busy every night of the week.  But it's only fair as I have found some great places using this site.  If your in the area and in the mood for Italian you cannot find better.

We we're excited to try this place out, we'd heard great things. My friend got there first at about 10:50, we followed 5 minutes later. The boyfriend was on a business call with his real estate agent so we didn't order immediately. We ordered at 11:10 and our waitress, who never gave her name or even a hello, wouldn't budge on the breakfast ends at 11 rule. So we packed up and went and got breakfast at cracker barrel across the street.   Obviously very bad first impression. I would love to support a locally owned business, I work for one, but wasn't thrilled with the unfriendly and uncompromising environment.

Tried to eat breakfast here today.  We were next in line as a part of 3 with a party of 2 behind us.  There was a 6 seat table available.  It was 10:50am.  One of the servers said it would be a while as there are no tables available. We asked about the empty table right in front of us.  We were told that table was being held for a 10:30 reservation--even though it was already 10:50.  Needless to say, we left.
Went on Tuesday and they had a wing special so I took advantage of it.  Good wings Good service and tons of TVs.  Will go back and try the Pizza

I love this place! Been coming here for 12 years. We love the cold ham and cheese sandwich with fries. The pizza,salads and spaghetti are spectacular. Also don't forget the ice old Moose Drool on draft!

Local, unpretentious, clean, friendly, reasonable prices.. Always fast, friendly efficient service, The Pasta here makes you wonder how Olive Garden stays in business..(The Crack infused into the bread sticks..) Great Seafood dishes for under 15 bucks.. And the best 6.99 crab cake on the planet..BTW Jan E. Aint lying.. Pasta Giovanni... Go Get sum of Dhat.. When Chicken and Pigs have intercoarse.. this is what happens..

If you like Italian this is the only place to go. All their pasta dishes are fantastic. My fav is the Baronessa with the Alfredo sauce with mushrooms and artichoke hearts. Their sub sandwiches are yum and if you want a salad their chef salad is outstanding. Enough for two people! Friends had the lasagna, pronounced excellent and veal piccata also excellent. Don't be turned off by the neighborhood! And get there early if you don't want a long wait!
We have loved everything we have gotten from here! Highly recommend the medium wings, the sauce is delicious and the pizza is to die for!

We were just traveling on the interstate and tried to find a place to eat that we'd not eaten at before.  This was the PERFECT place.  The place was packed - which was a good sign.  The staff was friendly and courteous and got to us fast.  The service was fast and the food was excellent.  We have a family of four and we got four different items.  All of them were delicious.  As we were leaving, the parking lot was filling up and more people were standing outside waiting.  I don't know if we'll be in this area and have the opportunity to eat here again, but it was very well worth it this time.

One of my favorite breakfast spots.  I come here on weekends with my boyfriend.  They offer a full menu of breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  For breakfast they always have specials which tends to be pork chops and eggs, Chorizo scramble, or Eggs Benedict.  I usually get the letter D combo, which is eggs, bacon or sausage, and french toast.  I get my eggs scrambled with their homemade salsa!  It's the perfect amount of food for only $4.95.  Awesome deal!    I've also had their Margherita pizza and Pasta Giovanni.  They are both scrumptious!  All their food looks good so I'll have to try some new dishes!

This has become our sunday morning go to breakfast joint.  Yes, there is a Denny's, Waffle House, and Cracker Barrel across the street.   I like the staff and would rather give my money to a local business.  Keep it up Times Square!!!  And they do a nice take-out when you are not up for the crowd and chatter.  A great family place.

We had the veal parm, pepperoni pizza, lasagna, and a cannoli. You either like the sauce they make or you don't. We thought all it has an interesting nutmeg/celery/lamby flavor. The veal was cooked well, not overdone. The cannoli was different, but good different. Has a more custardy creamy ricotta filling than most. It's very open so it's  loud, hard to hear the person talking across the table. So don't go for quiet ambiance.

1st time here. I hear it's really good! Rtf  Okay, here we go in a New York minute I'll sum this up...  Times Square lived up to the word on the street.  Cheese Stuffed Tortellini is worth every calorie and the savory veggie pizza is a veggie lovers dream come true!  During lunch rush seating took place within five minutes, then the food came out steaming hot and ready within twenty minutes.  The waitress and everyone else were friendly and quick with beverage refills.    I did notice with the small capacity room that if a lot a people are waiting, it can become an issue considering their limited waiting area section & bar.    I enjoyed the food and overall service, so YELP I recommend this place!
Great Place. Real causual and relaxed. All of their food is great. Honestly one of the best itallian joints in Arizona!!  Also some great seafood/italian dishes that are hard to find anywhere else!!

This is my family's favorite stop for breakfast. Eggs Benedict, biscuits and gravy are delicious! Service is friendly and quick. Dinner is great too! We always order a philly cheese steak, alfredo, and cannoli (or two) for dessert! The beer selection they have on tap is always amazing!

The food here is great. The service is hit and miss. I tried out a 2nd Alaska amber beer and told the waitress Suzanna I didn't care for it but she didn't listen and bought me another on what I thought was a gift but charged me for it. Being the polite guy I am I drank it because I didn't want to make a fiss but beaware of the charges becaus they are rather on the high end but again the food is healthy, tasty and, filling .t

The Wife and I eat here quite often. Usually dinner once a week, and breakfast on the weekends.  I read one review that stated breakfast was "overpriced" - this made me laugh. It is overpriced, if you hold it the average price for breakfast in 1943. Breakfast here is cheaper than any of the large crappy places (Waffle House, Denny's, IHOP, etc.) The nearest place in town that has similar pricing is Alexi's  - and the quality of the breakfast at Times Square is 10 times better, for the same price. The wife and I can order our breakfast, and two drinks (Tea usually) and it is under 15 bucks with tip. That is cheap.  They have several breakfast specials that are all under $5 each, and more than enough food. I usually get the one that has two eggs, bacon, and french toast (I it $4.xx) and my Wife gets two eggs, hashbrowns, toast (which is $3.xx.) She usually requests that the hashbrowns be well done, and they have always been happy to do so.  Dinner wise we split the Tortellini D'Angelo. We order it minus the chicken (The wife is a vegetarian.) They have never complained about it, nor do they have any issue with us sharing a dish (it is large enough for two!)  I have had the pizza, which is very good, and well priced. Their Fettuchini is also great according to one of my very picky friends.  The service can be slow sometimes, and it does get packed on some days, but it is worth the wait. This is our favorite Italian place to eat in phoenix.

Had the Linguini Principessa 15.95 Shrimp and Chopped Clams in a Garlic Cream Sauce  Excellent taste maybe noodle could have been a little more al dente but was acceptable.   Our waiter did a great job. Food served promptly.  No errors on our orders for ten people with five separate checks.

My husband's work hosted a party at this location this past weekend.  We pulled up and it was packed.  Luckily they had reserved an area in the back for us.  While we were waiting, we made our way to the bar and service was good and quick.  Especially considering how crowded it was.  They were able to accomodate our large group easily.  The service was fantastic!  Our server was on top of things.  Drinks, menus, delivery of food, keeping drinks filled, etc.  The food was outstanding!  We ordered several apps including the mussels, calamari and crabcakes.  Everything was perfect and I would recommend all.  We all ordered individual dishes.  All the pasta dishes were out of this world.  I ordered the Calamari cesar salad and it was huge!  It was covered in calamari, not just small bites and very flavorful.  We also ordered several desserts including the cheesecake, cream brule and tarimisu.  Everything was wonderful!  And the prices were amazing.  I can't wait to go back and try their pizza!

Came here for my first time on mother's day for lunch. Right away we received excellent service from our server Teresa. She  was really sweet and helpful with recommendations it being our first time. The food was amazing. Great food. Great service. We will definitely be back!

I have been here 3 times now and I have been more than satisfied with each visit.  There isn't much in the way of local Italian joints North of the 101, so when I finally discovered this little hole in the wall, I knew I had to check it out.  The first clue that I had that this place was legit, was that it was jam packed.  Right away looking at their menu I was a bit overwhelmed, so i did what I normally do anytime I visit a restaurant for the first time - I asked the server for her suggestions.  She suggested the Linguini Principessa, which was a nice fresh seafood pasta dish in a lovely cream sauce.  Delicious.  My 2nd visit included pizza and wings.  I went for the white pizza, and I thought it was wonderful.  A nice crust, with fresh ingredients on top.  For my latest visit I went with the Pollo Marconi, and I have to say that so far this was my favorite dish!  The chicken was so tender, and that sauce...mama mia! I have never tasted a sauce so delicious!  They have a great wine selection as well.  What really won me over about this place though, was the service.  Fast, friendly, prompt...so hard to find in good restaurants these days.  This is one of my favorites places now...I want to try everything on their menu :)

When it comes to authentic Italian in Phoenix, not many places come to mind. Times Square is one of those few places though. I've had the Chicken Piccata, Penne all vodka with meatballs and the Rigatoni all Laura. All were excellent and big portions. You really can't go wrong with anything you order here....pasta, chicken, pizza, subs, desserts. I am a huge sucker for cannoli as well and they have the best I've had in Phoenix! If you want great Italian food, come to Times Square!

Love this place!  Never a bad meal. All foods we've tried are wonderful. It is like eating at the home of your best Italian friends! Love it! Not fancy but always lively and somewhat fun. Highly recommend!

Amazing experience.  Had the fried cheese. ..that's a meal itself!  Also had the peppers and sausage over pasta, very good.  A little greasy but that could be the sausage. Worth it. 2 meals of leftovers with it. Great service. A little hard to have a conversation it gets loud and busy. Will return.

Good food but charges on check were more than on menu, had to go to register to pay bill and while away from my table the busboy stuck a napkin and silverware in the FULL beer I'd left on the table (intending to come back to the table to finish it). Teenage cashier refused to comp me for the $2.25 beer.......I live nearby, have been a long time customer, but won't be back.
I love this place. I have been coming for years and get great food and service all the time. Try the Arancini app. The best.
Times Square has some of the best Pizza around. They deliver too!  The subs are amazing. I had the meatball and it was huge.

This place will totally surprise you. I had the dish with sausage and mushrooms in an incredible cream tomato sauce. It was fabulous. Sampled my coworker's ravioli which was also very good. Prices are good and the staff is very friendly. If you're coming for lunch come early because it fills up fast. Portions are very large so you'll have enough for lunch or dinner again.

What a great family restaurant. Been going here for a few years and think it truly a find for north valley. You can tell there is a lot of pride in the service and food here.   The staff is always friendly and the food is amazing. Have tried many of the dishes, muscles and pasta, osso buco...all amazing!.   Their pizza is very reasonable and delicious. The wings are baked and very tasty. Try the medium they have the best flavor.    Like any busy place that's good, there can sometimes be a wait to be seated. However have never had to wait more than 15-20 minutes tops. I have had only one less than favorable experience over the past two years of going there and they were spot on to make it right.  You will not be disappointed.
Excellent New York style pizza. Fried Mozzarella is very unique and really delicious. They also have a fantastic appetizer with Eggplant, tomatoes, home made Mozzerella cheese & Balsamic.

Amazing amazing amazing. If you want great Italian food this is a must try spot. The pizza is great too! I order the calamari and shrimp salad for lunch in the summer its light and refreshing. The tortellini DeAngelo is a WOW soooo good! Don't hesitate if you want Italian just go you won't be disappointed.

This is the best casual Italian restaurant in the Phoenix area - the atmosphere is nothing fancy - but the food is 5 stars - never had a bad meal here - all your favorites are hear- pastas, gnocchi, ravioli, linguine with clams - veal parm - pizza - its as close to NY in Phoenix - go, but on Friday or Saturday nights be prepared to wait - but it is worth it

One of our favorite restaurants.  We have been going there for several years, and sometimes several times a week.  We know most of the staff by name.  They are great people serving great food.  When my Father passed away last year, some of the staff even came to the service.  They make you feel like family.  BREAKFAST-  Order anything on the menu, it's all been good.  My favorite is either "K", Chorizo & Eggs (weekends only), breakfast burrito (weekdays only), or steak & eggs.  Everything is cooked the way you want it, and they give you a nice sized portion.  The Chorizo & Eggs is served w/ whole pinto beans which I feel is a nice touch.  Their homemade salsa is also very good.  LUNCH/DINNER-  Pizza has been very good.  They have both neapolitan and sicilian.  I have had the "pizza by the slice", and that has been hit & miss, but the whole pies have been great.  The Ossobuco at Times Square is my favorite meal there.  If I were "going to the chair", it would be my choice for my last meal!  I have had it in other restaurants w/ risotto, and also w/ polenta.  Times Square serves theirs over fettuccine pasta w/ a very nice sauce.  The "Linguine Spinach" & "Pollo Limon" (not on the menu, but always available) are also very, very good.   One of my favorite things about Times Square is their consistency and quality.  I like going into a restaurant and seeing the same faces.  The turnover there is very low, and the staff & servers get to know you and your likes.  It's not uncommon to see the owner there, working the register, bar, seating, even serving when busy to help out.  It's also not uncommon to get a wave and a hello from the head Chef.    Truly, one of my favorite restaurants...

This is probably the best Italian food I've had.  Service is great. It's a small but busy place. Well priced. Everything tasted super fresh. I don't think there is ever a bad dish served. I've been there several times, tried a different dish each time and it was great. I will be going back again and again
One of my go to places breakfast or lunch every time I've been there the food is great and service is always friendly and fast

Went for lunch last week and was pleasantly surprised. The bruschetta melted in my mouth! I had the chicken parmasian sandwich and loved all the cheese...the bread was delicious. I will definitely be back.

OK, already!  After running across this restaurant several times in smartphone apps we decided to find Times Square and chow down on what was described as unbelievably good Italian food.  Reviewers have got it right, this place is fantastic.  Shea, our server was great and she knew the menu which is pretty extensive.  Before I begin, be warned that the place gets crowded quickly around dinner time so an early arrival is suggested.    Now for the food.  First, the anti pasta is wonderful.  It has all the ingredients an anti pasta is supposed to have.  Most Italian restaurants nowadays just put some iceberg lettuce, a sliced tomato and if you are lucky, a pepperoncini.  Times Square's dressing with the anti pasta was just right, not overpowering the decilicious vegetables and meats.  The meats, wrapped around cheese or olives, were delicious--you may read delicious once or twice in this review.  The entrees are varied, substantial and, again--delicious with a capital D.  We both had pasta dishes and the sauces were thick and yummy.  Bread was served with the main dish, my only suggestion would have been for the bread to have been served with the anti pasta.  Could not eat all of the food so take-home boxes were gladly volunteered.    You will be slightly incredulous that this restaurant located where it is would be so great.  It will be great.  Times Square also serves breakfast, kind of unusual for an Italian eatery but no problem as far as I am concerned--keep serving incredible Italian meals and I am completely satisfied.  (I hear the breakfasts are great by the way.)  All in all, we will be back and can't wait to do so.   Thank God there are great places like Times Square to move the chain Italian restaurants aside.
Very good food and service was prompt. Will be returning to this place. The salads are so good and they give you a big portion you can share. Pastas had great flavor.

Had a craving for Italian food. Seen this place for years but never gone in. Somehow got the fam to agree try to this joint. Restaurant is on the smaller size and was packed on a Friday night. The friendly hostess said about 20 minute wait. I stepped over and ordered a sangria for me and beer for the man. It seemed like a lot of regulars here! Spoke to a nice couple that lived even further away than us, so thought it must be good! I asked the hostess any faves when she was seating us and she said listed several items. She left and then came back and said she put in a bruschetta for us since was our first visit. So sweet of her! It was so good. The overall energy inside the restaurant was awesome. Shea was our server and she was wonderful! I learned so much about the food and the people. Everything was delicious! We had such a nice time. I cannot wait to go back! I heard they also have great breakfast here!

Was contemplating going to this restuarant for over 1 year. Finally went during lunch with my son and not super impressed with the pizza. My 3yr old wasn't either; but my husband ended up meeting us there and he got a pasta dish that he liked a lot. I would go again but not for pizza they have breakfast so would for sure try that!   I will update if I get to go again.

Great place for lunch! It's a non-descript restaurant - looks like a diner when you walk in, but the place is always packed. The food is delicious and reasonable! The fried mozzarella is huge like a brick! I've had the bruschetta and calamari - both equally great!  The portions are huge so don't load up on the appetizers like I usually do and then end up ordering a salad! Service is usually spot-on - I have never had any problems here. I find it is consistently good - so if you are an Italian food fan - you will love this place!

These guys have amazing restaurants!  All the food is amazing!  We are regulars and suggest the Giovanni and the Princepessa.  The Mahi on pesto is crazy yummy!  They make their own pesto and the ranch is so great that they sell it now.

This is our families favorite Italian Restaurant in the area.  We have eaten here a couple times per month for the last five years.  The tortellini Di Angelo is my wife's favorite and me and my boys love the Pizza and Wings.  The service is always excellent and they always go out of their way to make us feel special.  We have a large family of six boys and they remember us by name and are always so patient and friendly to us.  We have celebrated many special occasions over the years here.  They get really busy on Fridays and Saturdays, so it is best to make reservations before 2pm otherwise you may wait a bit on the weekends during the dinner rush.  But it is well with the wait.  Highly recommend.

Small place, but GREAT food; very authentic Italian.  Not where you want to go for a romantic dinner, but great family place.  The bruschetta and fried mozzarella are amazing.  The chicken Caesar salad is always a sure thing and today I tried the dinner special and it was so good; cheese tortellini & chicken with a pesto sauce.

I wanted to like this place, so I gave it two chances.  On my first visit I ordered the Pescatore.  The clams, mussels and shrimp were delicious, but the calamari was so overcooked, it was like chewing on rubber bands.  So, I missed out on one of the key ingredients because it was inedible.  Also, the sauce was so watered down, it had no flavor.  On my second visit we ordered wings and cheese steaks.  The wings had a very good flavor but I have to wonder where they find such anemic chickens.  These were the tiniest wings I've ever encountered.  Several of the wings had less than a bite of meat on them.  The cheese steaks were the worst I've ever had.  The meat was sooo overcooked, it had a bad, burnt taste.  And the cheese is only placed top.  A  good cheese steak has the cheese intermingled with the meat, so you get a taste of both in every bite. To be fair, one of my dining companions had the cheese pizza and it was very good, so it appears they can make one item well.

I am not from the Phoenix area, but was in town this weekend for a baseball tournament. After the game, myself and my boyfriend (who was starving after all the games) turned to Yelp to look for a good place for dinner. We found Times Square right away and I cannot begin to explain how pleased I was! When we got there it was PACKED... Always a great sign for a smaller place. (:  Coming from an Italian family, I am picky when it comes to eating out at Italian restaurants... However, the reviews were amazing and we decided we should give it a try! I was BLOWN AWAY by how authentic the food was. From the pasta, to the pizza, and salad, it was all delicious.   We've agreed any time we are anywhere near the Phoenix area, we will be paying this cute little place a visit.
Little rough around the edges but the breakfast food is great.  I haven't had dinner there yet but I will the next time in town.

The place small but the food is awesome! Build your own pizza, or have the gnocci in cream sauce (ask to have breakfast bacon sprinkled into it).  The Joe's special is awesome if you are on a diet - excellent chicken breast and sauted spinach.  My daugher loves the chicken Parm sandwich.  Ask Shay to make you a martini - they are the best :).  Also, I highly recommend the Rigatoni A la Laura. But don't kiss anyone after wards - lots of garlic!

A small friendly, clean diner with a friendly kind of family atmosphere. THE best breakfast sausage IMO, awesome omelets, great home fries; VERY friendly and efficient staff. The place is always fairly busy, and no surprise, the service is great, the food is awesome and the prices are very fair. As well as the breakfast offerings they also do excellent Italian food - perfect for a lunch or to take home for dinner.

Terrible embarrassing experience on March 26, 2018, approx. 5:00pm  My wife and I ate here twice. First time was a pleasant meal. Second time we ate there the food was unbelievably mediocre - soup tasted "right out of a can" We complained and management gave us a free beer. So, OK. I did not really want to return.  March 26, 2018 my brother suggested we meet there for a dinner due to the "raving wonderful reviews" he read. Not wanting to disappoint him I agreed, met him there. He got there before me. Ordered an appetizer from a waitress with tattoos on her arms, wrong one arrived, she took it back, second one arrived. OK.   I finally got there, as we ordered my brother attempted to order by showing the waitress his request from the menu. She said she would not look at the menu and rather forcefully insisted he verbally tell her what he wanted. He did and began to stutter due to embarrassment - and he is a paying customer. I was shocked to witness this exchange going on.  My turn to order, by this time I was stressed that she would snarl at me. I ordered. Food arrived, absolutely mediocre; really it was tasteless stuff you could get anywhere. (second time I had mediocre food there)  After 10 minutes my brother told me how unpleasant the whole experience had been so far. He explained the waitress made him fell small, as if she was a bossy mother. I totally agreed. Without finishing his meal, he just left. I felt sorry for him and angry. (and it was his idea to go to this place)  I wanted to pay, she never came back so I flagged down other servers who quickly brought the bill and pack-out container. $50.00 for this experience-I gave no tip. Asked to speak to the manager - they sent over the "tattooed waitress." After summarizing the whole experience to her, she of course apologized. I told her we would never come back there again.   Currently I work for a local grocery store chain. There is a phrase posted in the lunch room, "a customer never forgets how you make them feel."   This was an awful experience, with mediocre food. Never again.

This place is absolutely stellar. If you have never tried it I would highly recommend it.   Protip: If you like Pizza, try theirs, you can order it to go and pick it up (Same with all of their food.)  I have had their Mozzarella appetizer which is a big slab of fried cheese cooked to perfection. Their Alfredo is authentic and tasty, and their pasta Giovanni is something I could eat till I exploded. It is absolutely the best tasting Italian food I have had hands down. Bucca? Pshhhh. Olive Garden? Yeah OK.   The wait staff has always been prompt and polite. The wait can be grueling but its worth it I promise you.  They do have a very nice bar, very friendly and nicely done in marble.  Come early and often, make reservations for big parties this place is tiny, or order to go, but whatever you do? GO HERE. This place is absolutely fantabulous!!!

This food is amazing. I'm not a fan of chain restaurants and unfortunately the side of town I live on is filled with them so most the time I make the drive for good food. This place is sort of what I would call, a hole in the wall?  Hidden gem?  Menu has so many options. Food is authentic and awesome. Service is great. Kitchen is open so you can see them preparing your food, which I also love. If you want good quality food, not necessarily looking for ambiance, but just a delicious meal. Then this is what I recommend.  The wine menu isn't extensive. But what they had was good. Totally recommend!!

I was recently discussing with a friend about an Italian restaurant in my neighborhood when she asked if I had ever been to Times Square. I had never heard of this place but decided to give it a try. So it is late afternoon on Saturday and the hubby & I and another couple went to eat a late lunch /early dinner at Times Square. My friend had told me that everything was good. They are located on the NEC of 26th Ave & Deer Valley Road. If you are not careful you will pass right by the place. The businesses on either side are vacant and the restaurant doesn't have a huge sign to identify them.   We ordered the Pollo Marconi, Chicken Caesar Salad and a sub that was kind of a best of everything. Every one of us was oohing and awing over the meals.   My Pollo Marconi would have been plenty to split between two people. It came with a side of pasta that was delicious and with garlic bread.  We ordered three different deserts and passed them around. The bread pudding, which was the servers recommendation, was divine. It had a Jack Daniels sauce that was YUMMY! The tiramusui was heavenly and the canolli was the authentic real deal..   The servers were prompt and kept the glasses filled. It had a great family feel. The owner of the restaurant even turned the television from a sports game to the cartoon channel so a family with 5 little kids would be occupied until their food arrived.   There is a bar area for the adults. While I was there there were 4 meals of mussels served to other tables so that looked like a popular item.  This is my new favorite restaurant and I highly recommend everyone stop by for a taste. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. I can't wait to return and try the breakfast menu.  Prices ranged from $7.00 - $15.00

I think if you want to test the pasta then try the gnocchi.  So I did! The dumplings were good sized and the sauce was good but the dumpling it self was very heavy.  It should be light almost like a cloud in your mouth.   The bread that came with was good but as far as true Itailan it doesn't really measure up.  I have had the pizza in the past and it is good but I feel like almost any pizza joint can put out an okay pie.  I will go again for pizza but if your looking for true Itailan go else where.

This place is INCREDIBLE.  We just bought a house in the area and just happened upon this place.  This is definitely our new Friday night spot!  Can't wait to try breakfast on Sunday!  We had the Pasta Giovani, garlic bread, and cheese steak.  This place is #nomdotcom!!!   So good!!!  Shannon was our server, and he was fantastic!!

This place sure has changed a lot over the years - and for the most part, for the better.  They've updated their look since I was last here about 2 years ago with new furniture, paint job, decorations - looks more like a family Italian dinner place than the local, grimy-but-charming Italian lunch place I frequented.  The menu has been changed, and gone are the handful of lunch specials that could be had for $6-10 (this is what I miss), replaced by a single lunch special and a menu where most items are $10-15.  The food had always been good, and that has been maintained.  I still recommend their calzone - at $6.95 and $0.75 a topping, it's a reasonably priced lunch item that WILL fill you up (or provide an afternoon snack).  Italian sausage and basil pesto were delicious!  My friend was very pleased with the shrimp pasta (which he really should have made two meals of, but was wallowing in pleasant agony after finishing).  They still have a bar, and plenty of tv's, and think it likely still a good place to grab an after work libation and catch a game - but only if your part is small - it's not the largest place.  I'll be back for more calzone combinations!
Great place with excellent food and service.   Pastrami and cheese sandwich was probably the best I have ever had!

It is so hard to find semi authentic Italian food in Arizona and this for sure hit the mark . Fresh ingredients, great combinations of flavors , had all my favorite dishes , what more can you want? Try the bruschetta it amazing . Wine was low end but who cares the food made up for it. The staff was really friendly and made you feel at home

My girlfriend and I recently moved across the street from this establishment. We notice every time we drive by and finally got around to giving it a shot.   We walked in without a wait, it's a slower time of the day on a Sunday evening. We were served by a very nice man named Austin. He was extremely polite and thorough. He never let my water get empty and I must have drank three glasses.   My girlfriend and I split both a small margherita pizza and the Pollo Parmesan. Both were INCREDIBLE. They tasted amazing. Especially the pizza. I found myself thinking why would you ever need to deliver pizza? If it was this good everywhere people would never have a problem driving to pick it up.   The only reason I gave the place 4 stars and not 5 is because I'm a firm believer that there is always room for improvement, but in all honesty, this restaurant has done an incredible job with all of the things that matter most when it comes to food service.   We will be back for sure, and we feel like we got a little bonus since the place is walking distance from our new home. Thank you Austin, and the rest of Times Square.
Great food and service- we'll definitely be back. We loved the cioppino, yummy pizza and clams in white wine sauce. Several great desserts.
Excellent service. Very fast. Very good prices and the food was awesome. The best tortellini I've ever had. Such good flavor. The portions are huge.

This homely little restaurant is a delight. It was pretty busy, especially for a Sunday night at 7pm. The 6 of us were still seated right away and offered beverages immediately, which seemed to come out faster than she could have put in the order. Our parents shared 2 14" pizzas, and judging by the amount they ate, it must have been quite good. The wife and I shared a cheese steak and it really hot the spot. The meat was good and the whole thing was delicious with just the right amount of greasy. The employees were very friendly and attentive. We would definitely come here again. It could use a few more beer options on draft.

We just moved near here and from the outside didn't really know what this place was but saw the reviews and decided to try it.  It was packed but we were seated in the promised time.  Started with the calamari which wasn't bad but a little dense and not alot of flavor. My husband had his usual a meatball sub which he liked.
