My daughter ate her whole bowl of ravioli and I had the linguini puttanesca which was delicious. We took home creme Brule and bread pudding for dessert both were excellent just like grandma had made them. This place will be a family favorite.

Great food and always friendly service even if they do get a bit overwhelmed and slow during rush hours. This place can get packed, so we try to time our visits during off-peak hours. Definitely the best pasta dishes we've found in AZ so far.
great breakfasts and great italian food. highly recommend
Short and to the point: The food is good. Littleneck clams as steamers for about $11 a dozen. Moose Drool on tap.

This place was great. I probably drove past it a million times and would never have noticed it because of the area it's in, but my brother brought me here and I was pleasantly surprised.   The building looks like it used to be a grease spoon diner, but they dolled up the inside to look like a cozy, little Italian place. The floor space isn't very large, so the spread of the tables is a bit close. Not to worry. the food definitely distracts from any sort of flaws Times Square may have.   If I remember right (this review is a little late), I had complimentary garlic bread until my entree arrived. I ordered the Pollo Marconi, and it was amazing. Everything on the menu looked fantastic, but it was the eggplant on the Pollo Marconi that helped define my decision. I did not regret it.   And neither will you!  I totally recommend this place.   Oh, and they have Moose Drool on tap. I haven't seen that on tap at any of the other places I've been, even in the Northwest. Two thumbs up for Moose Drool.

For me, some of the best pizza and wings I have had in all the world. DISCLAIMER: I do have to order the wings crispy and 1/5 times they come out to cooked. The Pizza when slightly under cooked I LOVE which is usual but again 1/5 times it's crispy...I can live with those numbers. I've never ordered anything else

This place is excellent.  Pricey, yes, but the food is excelelnt and that IS the first reason we eat at a restaurant, right?  Nothing special on the outside and the inside is a touch on the spartan side, too.  No white table cloths here.  Booths.  A basic eatery decor.   Alaskan Brewing on tap - not sure where else in the Valley you can find that!  I usually get the pasta special and have NEVER been disappointed, even when it is something I might not ordinarily order.  Last week it was spinach gnocci in bacon cream sauce.  Amazing!  Wings are pretty good as well.  Old time waitressing with fun chatting and joking if you wish.  A friendly place that appreciates your business.  Don't arrive too late for lunch or you will be hunting for a parking spot in the gravel lot out back.

Hidden gem in the valley. This place doesnt look it but it has the best chicken parm in phx. I dont care where in the valley you live get in your car and drive there, yes now! You will not be disappointed, well at least I wasnt. Again the CHICKEN PARM that is all you should be ordering, well that and the fried mozzarella.

Decided to try times square again even with the poor experience with burnt pizza the last time and this time I decided to open the box to check the pizza and its no surprise that both the pizzas a Sicilian style pepperoni and a small Marguerita piazza both BURNT!!!! IM SO DISSAPOINTED. THEY ARE CURRENTLY REMAKING BOTH PIZZAS AS WE SPEAK SO WE WILL SEE IF I they are burnt again or if I will be asking for my money back.  It was a mistake to come here again.  Will never come again.

Haven't been to this place in a while and it used to be one of my favorites.  I noticed that their pizza started getting greasier, the cheese heavier, and the crust thinner.  I would always ask for it well done and it never was.  I even started asking for it extra well done and they still couldn't get it.  Not sure if they changed the cheese or dough  or if they got some new pizza guys in there, but I don't go there anymore because of the inconsistency.  The drinks are kind of expensive for the type of place it is too.  Bummer.
My favorite restaurant. Out of this world. The pasta is so good you cannot stop eating it. I will continue to come back and hope this place never leaves.

All my hubs and I can say is, HOMERUN!!! service, food was great. We came for lunch and will be back for dinner!  Do not listen to the negative reviews.  I had the veal with artichokes in a cream sauce with penne...delish! Hubs had steak sandwich. He said " hands down, best steak sandwich I ever had" Oh, and btw, our server was Grace, and she was wonderful! Thanks Grace for a great experience!

Probably the best Italian food ever!!! Calamari with sauce, the chef salad can feed 3-4 peoples and the linguini spinach... yum til the end of the meal...!!! Tiramisu will be the desert of the night... recommended family own Italian restaurant

Had some take out pizza last year during holidays... Forgot all about the place but came across it on Yelp,, close to work n try it out.. Went by Friday afternoon, and there was seriously a 30-45 minute wait... Nothing can be worth the wait, so we decided to come back another day,,,,,   Monday early lunch, place about half full..  Ordered the NY Combo -- Once we got our pizza i had a flash back to the pizza we got during holidays,, n BAM,,, this stuff is great pizza... Decent prices..   Not my #1 Pizza place,, but pretty darn close.  Next trip will try the pasta, or the Samiches, as they looked amazingly delish as they went by our table....   Def a Weekly goto place......  Went back and Tried the Cheese Steak Special.... AWESOME... not sure if I can try anything else now that i found the goto item...
Great pizza and pasta  Hidden jewel on deer valley and 27th avenue Been ordering take out for a coupl year

Great food,  very happy we went here.  My daughter had Rigatoni Alla Laura, wife had Sausage and Pepper Platter with Penne Pasta, my son the Cheese Ravioli and I had two slice of sausage pizza as well as the Mediterranean Salad.  Everything was superb! We all enjoyed this place and will be back

My husband and I started dining at Times Square recently at the insistence of our adult son, who has impeccable taste in anything relating to food. I almost regret having ever tried it as I have easily gained 5 pounds since my first visit 3 months ago. Sure, it's not the fault of the restaurant any more than it could be a spoon's fault that I am a little thicker now... but still I have to wonder.   The outside of the building is nondescript. In fact I have been driving past this establishment for years and never paid it any attention though I remember the parking lot has often been full. The building does not catch your eye unlike the Castle Boutique whose entrance is opposite of the parking area for Times Square. Inside the dcor is simple, not overdone, and the hand drawn images on framed napkins in the bar area depicting numerous faces are unique.  There are multiple flat screen TV's playing sporting events just in case "the game" happens to conflict with dinnertime.    Our first experience was with a group of 6 during a Friday evening rush in December. Our server was well versed in all menu items, patient, quick to take our drink & appetizer orders and just as quick to serve in spite of the bustling bistro. She returned, personable and unfrazzled, to check on how everything was and to see if we needed anything at just the right times. It doesn't matter that I don't recall her name, all servers here are equally adept and there are plenty of them on hand to take care of customer needs each time we come here, which is usually during the 6 - 7 PM rush on a Friday or Saturday. Keep in mind, though, this place is almost just as busy during Sunday - Thursday evenings as well so expect to wait a few minutes to be seated if you haven't made reservations. I would like to mention that we were not charged gratuity on our group of 6, which resulted in a great tip for our server; she earned it!  There is a well stocked bar attended by welcoming bartenders to address your thirst requirements, be they in the form of alcohol, water, or amazing food. We've eaten at the bar a couple times and were pleased to be visited by one of the chef's to ascertain our opinions on the dishes we ordered. If we could have taken him home we would have.   Now for the food: For appetizers, my husband is a HUGE fan of the crab cakes served with pesto mayo and lemon wedges while I enjoy the fresh bruschetta. My favorite entre so far is the Penne Alla Aribiatta without chicken or sausage. I am a vegetarian and have been told by the servers that I am welcome to order just about anything on the menu without meat and the chef will be happy to prepare it. This dish, however, is so ridiculously flavorful that I have not been able to bring myself to order other entrees just yet. In time.  Other fantastic items on the menu (according to my meat eating spouse): Pasta Giovanni, Spaghetti Alla Polpetti (homemade meatballs he fell in love with and can no longer live without), and the best Caesar Salad that has yet to grace his taste buds - I'll have to take his word since I don't do eggs either. He has had numerous other items and has loved them all.   This establishment is squeaky clean and very well run. This place is so popular they are in the process of opening a new location at 7th Street and Union Hills. They have been actively training new chefs since we became patrons in December 2013.   Tip #1: Reservations recommended, especially during the dinner rush. They take reservations for 5 or more but not after 3 PM for the same day. If making a reservation was not an option for you, grab a beverage from the bar and your table will be ready as efficiently as is humanly possible. They are very accommodating and the mouth-watering food and out of this world service are well worth the wait.   Tip #2: There are several more dishes/specialties on their menu in person than you will find in the online version, though the web version is quite considerable and gives you a good feel for what to expect.   Tip #3: There is ample parking out back if the front lot is full.   Tip #4: Lastly, but certainly not least, wear your buffet pants and make regular exercise part of your daily routine because you will quickly become as addicted as the rest of the crowd who has been fortunate enough to find this place.   That's it for my 2 cents!

Let's start with their breakfast, delicious and so very reasonably priced. My boyfriend loves the pork chops, I love the chorizo scramble (only available on weekends) and they serve breakfast until 1 pm the weekends. Their lunch and dinner portions are huge and yummy yummy!! The service is always great. The staff seem to have a family like feel to them. It's a great place I definitely recommend it.

First time trying the place, heard about it from a coworker. Got the seafood pescatore and it tasted as good as it looked it's a must try! All seafood and all glorious! Bae got the chicken Alfredo and said it was one of the best she's ever had. Highly recommended.

Have been here several times before and it was delicious. Yesterday, however, went for a late lunch around 3:30pm and was told there was no special because the chef hadn't come in yet. I ordered the chicken Marsala . It was no where near that. I don't know what it was but I forced it down. The sauce was water with chopped onions. No  mushrooms and Marsala sauce. Whoever cooked it should look up a few recipes          We will probably go back again as we have had delicious meals there. We will make sure the Chef is on duty however!
Worth the wait on a Friday night.  Love this place.  Everything is good.  We get the wings every time we come.
Saw this on Check Please and gave it a try.  Just mediocre food but service was great.   Skip the bread pudding.   Would go back for pizza tho.

I've been eating so much pizza lately, I think I might turn into one!  My buddy Mike was telling me about this place and he said it was legit.  It's only a few minutes up the road from where I work so I decided I would pick up a pizza for lunch.  I called them up and ordered a 14 inch Cheese PIzza.  Drove up there, picked it up and then headed back to work.  My total was just under $12.00 for the pizza.  I devoured this thing in my car during my lunch break.  It was delicious...I ate the whole damn pizza!  This pizza had a good medium/thin crust, really good sauce, good cheese (tad greasy) and great overall flavor.  It reminded me of some mom and pop type shops back where I grew up at in LA.  I will definitely be back.  The staff was friendly and joked around with me for a bit while I was picking up my food.  Good times!

This place is so delicious.   Started the meal with fried mozzarella. It is not your typical fried cheese stick. It is a single big piece of cheese smothered with delicious marinara sauce.  For my entree I had mussels over linguini and white sauce. The mussels were good size and cooked to perfection.   Others in my party had manicotti, baked ziti, and tortellini. Everyone was please with their selection and I enjoyed my sample of each.  The restaurant is a bit small so wait times may be an issue on some nights. We waited about 15 min. Food was well worth the wait

The food is delicious, the beer is cold and the staff is always helpful, friendly, and fun. They have awesome breakfast food, pizza, wings, subs, pasta, and so much more. I've never been disappointed here and always feel like family when we visit.

This place was amazing.  We have come for Spring Training for 8 years and always stay at the Purple Park about 2 miles away. This was a great find. We all had sandwiches and drinks and everything was great on top of outstanding customer service.  What a great find. This place will now be included in our yearly trip.

They have a great lunch menu but open for breakfast too. If you like blue cheese dressing on a salad youll love this place! Its creamy & made from scratch. Had penne marinara sauce for lunch with delicious bread! Highly recommend this place.

Be careful and be on the lookout. If you are just getting off the I-17 and don't pay attention, you may drive right pass Times Square Pizzeria! This is probably what I've done in the past and would have done had my father not introduced me to this amazing local Pizzeria!   My family and I visited Times Square Pizza on a Saturday early evening and it has a very friendly and homey cafe/diner feel. It was busy but comfortable and the staff was incredibly attentive and quick! Anytime I took a sip from my water there seemed to be someone on standby to fill it up! The service was great and I haven't even gotten to the food yet...  For the dishes, we ordered: Joe's Special, Pasta Giovanni, Philly Cheesesteak and good o'fashioned Spaghetti and meatballs. Each of us at the table seemed to forget how to be social and speak because we were consuming all the delicious food. Everything was very savory and seasoned well but I have to rave about the Pasta Giovanni. Yes, this dish is titled as a "favorite," and right away the picture on the menu and description sold it for me, and it exceeded my expectations! My whole family also loved it and there was absolutely no leftovers to take home! On top of the amazing dishes, they also give you what seems to be huge slices of garlic bread! All-in-all, very generous portions and flavors. I'm kind of glad I don't live nearby because I know I would find myself eating here way too often!  This place is amazing! Don't make the same mistake, visit here, order the pasta, you will be just as in love as I am!

I normally don't write reviews if I have a bad experience somewhere but this was so bad that I felt the need to post something. My boyfriend and I have gone here before and I have always gotten good food but he's had bad experiences prior to this incident. Last night we ordered a takeout order, and spend $50 . When we got it home we couldn't even cut through the lasagna that we had ordered and when we dumped it out on a plate we discovered that there was no noodles in this dish except for at the very bottom where there was 6 layers of uncooked lasagna noodles stuck together on the bottom. There was none sauce and cheese smeared on top. When I called later that night to ask what was going on and give my feedback, I asked for a manager and the woman on the phone said "why". By then got placed on hold and no one ever came back. I then called this morning I'm got put on the phone with "the manager", told him what happened and I got a very nonchalant "'m sorry".  He might as well have said "oh well get off the phone lady." They will no longer be getting my family's business and I'm so disappointed that this place has gone downhill so far. It's absolutely disgusting to see what has become of so many restaurants in Arizona. I highly recommend going somewhere else this place is no longer the gem it used to be.

This is the restaurant that you go to when you want the best italian food and when you remember to stop by before it gets too busy on the weekends.  We all know what that alternative is, and that is Olive Garden, the lesser of italian restaurants.  I only focus on one thing when i come here and that is the cheese steak sandwich, which is probably one of the tastiest sandwiches i have eaten.  I highly recommend the fried mozzarella as an appetizer and the creme brulee for desert.  This is the first place i have ever tried creme brulee and i almost yelled out loud with satisfaction.  The only flaw, its a bit small and so is the parking area, but if you make it, you wont be disappointed.  If i can give more than 5 stars, i would.

Decent but not even close to 5 stars.  They do well with their sandwiches (chicken parm sammich was pretty darned good) and okay with the pasta dishes, although their price exceeds their quality.  DO NOT bother with the pizza -- at least not the slices at lunch time.  They're precooked and reheated poorly, creating a crust that is hard and that you *wish* was flavorless, and congealing the cheese grease up quite nastily.  I will credit that even during busy lunch time, they've been able to accomodate a dozen or so people in a single party fairly efficiently.  On one occaision they put up quite a fight on the splitting of checks, but had no choice when most people had to pay by card; but on another occaision they split checks with nary a gripe.

Great fettucini alfredo.  I was not as impressed with the garlic bread- which was crunchy.  This place is very tiny, and in a bit of a strange location.  But I like the bar setup and ambience of this place.  We ate at the bar because we couldn't get a table.  Since it's so tiny it gets very crowded.  Not sure if they take reservations, but if they do you should make one or expect to wait a little bit for a table.  Our bartender was very busy tending bar and waiting on tables.  They don't have a wine list which is kind of weird.  You can't order bottles of wine, only glasses or caraffes.  Again, the food was great though.

Been here a number of times and always blown away. The pastas, pizzas, and daily specials are always fantastic. The deep dish is especially good.  Great happy for beer and slices. Awesomebreakfast too. You've got to try the pork chops for breakfast. The location is not the best, but who cares...the food makes up for that ten fold.

I come here whenever I visit phoenix because the food is so darn good and the atmosphere is relaxed and easy.  But seriously, the food is really good. We always try a new dish when we come and have never been disappointed. This time he had a sausage & angel hair Arribiata and I had a chicken eggplant tomato stack in tomato cream sauce. Just outstanding!  Always a lot of flavor, generous portions, and the service has always been on point. The complimentary garlic bread is always a plus since my husband cannot eat Italian without it. Can't wait to come back on my next visit.

My husband and I have decided to spend the next month supporting local restaurants  instead of chains. We are trying somewhere new every time we go out!! My friend Diana told me about this restaurant and we finally got to go. Quaint, great food, good reasonable wine and lovely service. We get coupons all the time for this. Of course I didn't have it with me. So use your coupons and enjoy this neighborhood restaurant!!  We'll go back I'm sure.   Thank you Times Square!!

I only gave 4 stars because I have only been here once but i will be back to try something else. I had the eggplant parm. and it was amazing!! The best I have ever had. The meatballs are good. I also had a cannoli and it was very good. It gets very busy for lunch so go right before noon. Great service and very friendly servers.

My bf and I were visiting his sister and staying at a hotel near here. Looking for a place to eat after getting in at PHX we didn't have much options and everything in the area closes at 10pm.  TSP was our best option. Came in. Got sat right away. I highly recommend ordering the Caesar salad and Alfredo with shrimp.  We ended up coming back 2 nights later for a margarita pizza. Wasn't the best.  Maybe stick to pasta? Or another pizza?  Still a good option if you're in the area looking for food.

My wife and I had our "second" first date here, so I admit I'm kind of biased. But this is the type of place I love, smaller, mom and pop type of place. Very friendly people. Never had a bad meal there, always have a special and very open to substitutions or special orders.  Full bar, take out, and breakfast!
The food is fantastic! I will visit again! The bread pudding is the best I have ever tasted. It's big enough to share!

The food is great and the prices are reasonable. The portions are large so come hungry.  The food here is a bit more "home style". It isn't trying to be some fine dining experience and some dishes are pretty heavy. But the flavors are great and I walked out feeling like I was visiting an Italian family member rather than some stuffy restaurant. The beer selection is pretty nice. As weird as it sounded, the Moose Drool was great!  A bit of a warning. From what I've heard this place gets packed during the weekend. Be ready to wait if you plan to walk in on a Friday night.

Have given this place NUMEROUS chances cause they are around the corner from me. I want to love them but their food is BLAND (and that's being nice) got chicken wings that taste like rubber (how do you screw up wings?) calamari was bland, no flavor at all. So for me... overpriced bad bar food.

I love this place we got a take out order of the NY combo pizza and the Tortellini De'Angelo and it was amazing as always and the taste of both where so good. I will recommend this place to anyone for some of the best Italian food around.

Right outside the Castle Boutique parking lot - so you can see what people look like who go there!  Well, the windows face south so not to easily... but anyway, the pastas were quite good and served piping hot.  They have a very small bar with a couple decent taps.  Prices are reasonable, but this place can be busy during the lunch rush.  There seem to be a lot of biker dudes here because of that motorcycle "school" down the street.
Excellent service and great food! Been here a few times and haven't been disappointed! Pizza, wings and calzones are amazing! Highly recommend!

Im always looking for something outside the chain of restaurants . I placed a to go order on my way home from Costco and had the Pasta Carbanara. THe pasta has peas , panchetta , onions and a creamy sauce . It was so sinful but amazing. I will keep Times Square in mind for my next italian craving .

One of our favorite restaurants. We even come here for breakfast. We've tried a lot of the dishes on the menu. The Tortellini De Angelo is probably one of my favorites. The staff here is great, too! Teresa and Grace are our favorites. Their prices are pretty reasonable for the portion. We seriously adore this place.

5* without batting an eyelash. food is amazing, service is amazing! I had the cheesesteak with all the fixins. ridiculous portions, fresh veggies, lots of cheese, fresh bread. other folks had the Italian, and a ham/cheese sub which they all said was awesome. the table shared the calamari which was solid. you know it's good when you get mini squids, large pieces of squid, and not those silly mini rings. can't wait to go back and try the pizza, wings, and pasta!
Food is TO DIE FOR!!!! So good!!!!! The cannoli is amazeballs!!!! Yum yum yum yum yum!!!!!!!!
Best authentic Italian food, cozy little place,  friendly staff,  the food amazing,  just a taste of Italy.

I went for the first time last night with friends.  Everyone loved their food (3 pasta dishes and my chicken parm sandwich.)  Our waitress was fabulous, attentive but not intrusive.  I love that she brought me a takeout box before I asked and offered to split the check four ways.  The place was packed, and there were many people coming in to pick up takeout orders, too.  I had a hard time hearing my friends because it was so busy; I don't think I'll eat there again, but I would definitely get food to go.

Ordered Sausage Sandwich which was very good size in a firm bun smothered with sauce and cheese and baked.  Also ordered the Spaghetti in Meat Sauce which was a huge serving and came with a large slice of Italian Bread.  Food was good but not the best that I have had. It is no frills but not to bad.
